title: houseki_no_kuni
body:
[b]Houseki no Kuni[/b] (宝石の国, lit. "Country of Jewels", English: "Land of the Lustrous") is an ongoing action/fantasy manga series. The series is written and illustrated by Haruko Ichikawa and has been published in Kodansha's [i]Afternoon[/i] magazine since December 2012.  The manga was on hiatus from December 2020 until June 2022.

Set in a world inhabited by "jewel people," it chronicles their efforts to find the place where they belong and defend their way of life.

An anime promotional video was released on July 2013. A 12 episode anime adaptation aired between October and December 2017.

h4. Characters

h6. Gems (Houseki)

A humanoid species made of gems that inhabit the land of the planet. There are 28 gems at the start of the story. They appear to be [[androgynous|genderless]].

title: vivienne_westwood
body:
Vivienne Westwood is a British [[fashion]] brand named after its founder by the same name. The logo and main symbol used in clothing, jewelry and accessories for the company is a [[globus cruciger]].

Despite being a British brand, Vivienne Westwood is very popular in Japan, especially in street and alternative fashion styles such as [[gyaru]] and [[punk]].

title: worldwide_miku
body:
The mid-2024 art trend of drawing [[Hatsune Miku]] in different countries' clothing, whether it be urban casual or traditional, or otherwise representing something in the world, no matter what or when.

It gained traction as a Twitter trend following the viral boom of [[Brazilian Miku]], posted on August 17th 2024, and quickly began to expand in scope beyond that initial template, first going beyond urban casual to encompass traditional clothes, then regional subdivisions of countries, nations without countries, historical countries, subcultures, fictional nations and worlds, prehistoric beings, and so on, until she became Everything Miku. This tag also includes posts which reference the trend specifically too, ex. post #8055554 and post #8063674, instances of other vocal synth characters having this trend applied to them such as Teto, and sub-trends developed out of this trend, such as in January 2025 with [[Argentinian Miku]].

title: small_kyubey
body: [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden|Magia Record]] character. A specimen of [[Kyubey]]'s race that only exists within Kamihama City, in which the game/anime adaptation is set. It regressed into this small, younger-looking state (its hoops fell off, and its eyes became noticeably bigger) as the result [spoiler]of three contracts: [[Tamaki Ui|Ui Tamaki]], [[Satomi Touka|Touka Satomi]] and [[Hiiragi Nemu|Nemu Hiiragi]] each wished to take the incubator's ability to absorb, convert and create energy, respectively, in order to save [[Tamaki Iroha|Iroha Tamaki]] from the fate of turning into a witch.[/spoiler] It doesn't speak outside of saying "Mokyu!", unlike the regular Kyubey. h4. External links * "Puella Magi wiki: Lil' Kyubey":https://wiki.puella-magi.net/Lil%27_Kyubey

title: batman_and_robin_(1997)
body: Batman & Robin is a 1997 American superhero film based on the [[DC Comics]] characters [[Batman]] and [[Robin (dc)|Robin]] by Bill Finger and Bob Kane. It is the fourth and final installment of Warner Bros.' initial Batman film series, a sequel to Batman Forever (1995), and the only film in the series made without the involvement of Tim Burton in any capacity. Directed by Joel Schumacher and written by Akiva Goldsman, it stars George Clooney as [[Bruce Wayne]] / Batman (replacing Val Kilmer) and Chris O'Donnell as Dick Grayson / Robin, alongside [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]], Uma Thurman, and Alicia Silverstone. The film follows the eponymous characters as they attempt to prevent Mr. Freeze (Schwarzenegger) and Poison Ivy (Thurman) from taking over the world, while at the same time struggling to keep their partnership together.

title: electric_razor
body:
A [[razor]] with electrically powered rotating or oscillating blades, designed for [[shaving]] [[body hair|body]] or [[facial hair]].

Not to be confused with an electric [[hair clipper]], which is designed for cutting longer hair.

h4. See also

* [[shaving]]
* [[safety razor]]
* [[straight razor]]

title: hair_clipper
body:
A tool used for [[cutting hair]]. A hair clipper generally comes with comb attachments for adjustable hair length and is not designed to shave as closely as an [[electric razor]] can.

The blades are arranged like "teeth" and cut by acting as many mini scissors.  Devices with smaller finer blades are typically marketed as "hair trimmers," while those with larger blades are marketed as "hair clippers."  The largest types are used on animals and are frequently referred to as "electric shears" or "mechanical shears."

h4. Examples

* !post #6707747
* !post #7575305

h4. See also

* [[electric razor]]
* [[cutting hair]]

title: leotard
body:
A [[skin tight]], one-piece [[bodysuit]] that covers the torso but leaves the legs free. Sleeves can be anywhere from [[sleeveless]] to [[long sleeves]]. They usually have a very simple design (often even just a single color), and are typically made of light fabrics to accommodate athletic activities. They are most often worn by acrobats, [[gymnastics|gymnasts]], [[dancer]]s, and circus performers.

They also influenced the [[one-piece swimsuit]] design, but swimsuits should not be tagged as leotards.

If the leotard does cover at least the upper legs, do not use this tag. Use [[bodysuit]] instead.

h4. Colors and Styles

title: safety_razor
body:
A [[razor]] that is designed to make [[shaving]] safer by attaching a protective device between the [[razor blade]] and the skin (as opposed to a [[straight razor]]).

This includes both traditional double-edge razors with disposable [[razor blade]]s, and modern razors with disposable cartridges or where the entire razor is disposable.

h4. Examples

title: china_tracksuit
body:
A standard-issued [[track suit]] used by various [[China|Chinese]] schools, most prominently during the 2000-2010s.

Actor "Wu Jing":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wu_Jing_(actor)] played a physical education teacher in 2019 movie Song of Youth wearing a [[green track suit|green tracksuit]] with "China" (中国) in giant characters. Wu Jing has been the lead actor for several patriotic-themed action movies, and a screenshot of him wearing a green tracksuit with China in giant characters has become one of the hottest memes on the Chinese internet in 2021. There's even a term for memes featuring Wu Jing, called "Jing Memes" (京图).

The meme has further spread after people started photoshopping words onto that screenshot, forming phrases with the word "China" (or "Chinese" depending on the context) in it. "Such as":https://view.inews.qq.com/k/20210417A045LC00 "Mosquitoes fk off of CHINA" and "Failed to lose weight, I blame CHINESE food for being too delicious". Especially during the [[2020 summer olympics|Tokyo Olympics]], where the meme had a blast on "Olympic related edits":https://twitter.com/dramapotatoes/status/1418876451496071168.

[[Genshin Impact]] did a [[parody]] "of this":https://www.superpixel.com/article/24660/genshin-impact-selling-meme-inspired-jacket with a short film in August 2021 featuring an actor wearing a sports jacket with "Liyue" (the nation in Genshin that's based on China) written on it. They also later started to sell merch of this tracksuit.

title: aquiline_nose
body:
An aquiline [[nose]], also called a Roman nose or hooked nose, is a type of [[nose]] which has a prominent bridge, giving the appearance of being bent or curved. [i]Aquiline[/i] comes from the Latin [i]aquilinus[/i], meaning "eagle-like", alluding to the curved beak-like shape of the nose. 

If the nose has a distinct slant at the top where it meets the face, or a prominent outwards curve, it should be tagged as such.

title: death_note
body:
A manga series written by Ooba Tsugumi and illustrated by [[Obata Takeshi]] and published on [[Weekly Shounen Jump]] on 2003. An anime adaption produced by [[Madhouse]] was aired from 2006 to 2007. There are also live-action adaptions, novels, and sequels.

[[Yagami Light]] is a brilliant young man who one day finds a black notebook called a [[Death Note (object)|]] which can kill anyone whose name is written in it. Light uses it to secretly kill criminals, drawing the attention of Interpol and the enigmatic detective [[L (death note)|]]. This ultimately leads him to a psychological game of cat-and-mouse as Light avoids the authorities while attempting to create a new world in his own vision.

title: ryuk
body: Ryuk is one of the main characters of [[Death Note]]. He is a [[Shinigami]] and the original owner of the [[Death Note (object)|Death Note]] that [[Yagami Light|Light Yagami]] gets his hands on, having dropped it into the human world to begin with just to see what will happen. He is primarily motivated by boredom and amusement.

title: matsuda_touta
body:
A character from [[Death Note]].

Part of the Kira Investigation Team.

title: aizawa_shuuichi
body: A [[Death Note]] character, Aizawa is an intelligent, respected member of both the NPA and Task Force. He takes his work very seriously and chooses to work strictly within the law. Out of all the members in the Task Force, Aizawa is the most overtly skeptical, questioning [[L (Death note)|]]'s basis for his conclusions and expressing the most doubt in them, and often finds himself clashing and opposing many of L's ideas and actions. He has a wife, Eriko, and two children, including Yumi, his daughter, and his baby son, whose name is unknown. Due to him rarely being able to visit home during his work on the [[yagami light|Kira]] case, his personal life and relationship with his family becomes strained.

title: l_(death_note)
body:
An enigmatic genius detective and rival of the main character [[Yagami Light]] in the [[Death Note]] manga and anime series.

He is a [[pale skin|pale]] young man with messy [[black hair]] and [[empty eyes|empty]] [[black eyes]] with [[bags under eyes|bags]] under them. He likes [[sweets]] and is known to sit in bizarre positions.

He assumes various aliases to protect his identity, including the name "Ryuzaki" for most of the series. His real name is [spoiler]L Lawliet.[/spoiler]

title: minecraft_youtube
body:
A term generally used to refer to specific Western [[Minecraft]] content on platforms such as YouTube and Twitch, especially those surrounding survival multiplayer servers (SMPs) and the communities that develop from them. Some creators stream themselves acting out elaborate LARPs in SMPs, which inspire artists to draw fanart of those creators, as well as those who more generally stream Minecraft. Both art of the streamers and art of the Minecraft servers they stream goes here.

The term is applied more on a cultural level than on a literal level - YouTubers that play Minecraft once often aren't considered to fall into this category as they do not have wider connections to the scene as a whole, which is largely collaborative and overlaps often.

Please note that the [[real life]] copytag should only be used for posts actually depicting content creators in real life and not their personas or in-game characters. Additionally, [[Minecraft]] should not be tagged unless elements from the game are present (such as scenery, locations, items, species, etc).

title: uohhhhhhhhh!_(meme)
body:
An exclamation of excitement, usually about [[loli|little girls]]. Frequently accompanied by the [[crying emoji]] (😭) and the slang "[[cunny (meme)|]]".

It originated from a tweet made in spring 2020 by [[dorontabi]] under the handle [nodtext]@mammoth_2020[/nodtext]:

[quote]うおおおおああああああ！！！子供エロっ!!!!!!子供の腹と胸!!!!!!エロだ...😭😭😭
[tn]Translated from Japanese by Google:[/tn]
Uohhhhhhhhh! !! !! Child erotic !!!!!! Child's belly and chest !!!!!! Erotic … 😭😭😭 [/quote]

h4. See also

h4. External links

body:
A comic book character who appears in the [[Marvel]] Universe. She is the [[father and daughter|daughter]] of [[Galactus]], hence why she wears clothes that resemble his. She was designed and co-created by [[elsevilla|Hector Sevilla]] and [[Adam_Warren|Adam Warren]].

Her most recent appearance is in the game [[Marvel Rivals]], where she serves as an announcer during matches.

title: hachijou_tooya
body:
[b]Major spoilers below.[/b]

Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro Ni]]. For [[Featherine Augustus Aurora]]'s human equivalent, see [[Hachijou Ikuko]].

[spoiler]"Hachijou Tooya" is [[Ushiromiya Battler]] following the murders on Rokkenjima, who lost his original memories by way of nearly drowning in an attempt to save [[yasu_(umineko)|Sayo Yasuda]]. He was later found by [[Hachijou Ikuko]] on the side of the road, and was able to bond with her over their love of mystery novels. Ikuko gave him his new name due to how he was eighteen (十, [i]tō[/i], ten, and 八, [i]ya[/i], eight) years old upon being found.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]After learning of Yasu's original forgeries from Ikuko, Tooya became unable to accept his original identity; due to both being the cause of painful headaches, and because Tooya became scared at the thought at having somebody else's memories. To cope with his past existence, he collaborated with Ikuko (who served as a ghost writer) to recreate the events of 1986 based on the forgeries; resulting in the framing device for most of Umineko itself.[/spoiler]

title: shiina_niki
body:
A character from [[Ensemble Stars!]] Music!

An [[idol]] who also works as a [[chef]]. He used to perform as part of a duo with [[Amagi rinne|Rinne Amagi]]. Though he's someone very easily swayed by the words of others, he has an overall chipper personality. He becomes wild and brusque once his stomach is empty. Normally, though, he has a friendly atmosphere about him and feels easy to talk to. With a mischievous voice, his performances are light and carefree.

Niki is a member of Cosmic Production's [[crazy b (ensemble stars!)|Crazy:B]].

H4. External Links
* "Ensemble Stars Fandom Wiki: Niki Shiina":[https://ensemble-stars.fandom.com/wiki/Niki_Shiina]

title: amagi_rinne
body:
A character from [[Ensemble Stars!]] Music!

An [[idol]] who lives and breathes his hobby, [[gambling]], and treats his life no different than one of those gambles. He used to perform as part of a duo with [[Shiina Niki|Niki Shiina]]. Though a cheerful and generous individual, there are times he can be not only wasteful, but downright tyrannical. He is [[Amagi Hiiro|Hiiro Amagi']]s older brother. He likes to test his luck. With a voice that's mischievous, as if he were playing some game, Rinne's performances are powerful and larger than life.

Rinne is a member of Cosmic Production's [[crazy b (ensemble stars!)|Crazy:B]].

H4. External Links
* "Ensemble Stars Fandom Wiki: Rinne Amagi":[https://ensemble-stars.fandom.com/wiki/Rinne_Amagi]

title: featherine_augustus_aurora
body:
The Witch of the Theater, she is said to have been the Game Master for countless other games in the past, though she has long-forgotten them. She possesses a crescent-shaped device which floats around her head, serving as a memory aid which maintains traits such as her name, appearance, and personality. She has [[Ushiromiya Ange]] read the story of Dawn of the Golden Witch and challenges her to find the truth about it. She may or may not be the true form of [[Hachijou Ikuko]].

While it is not confirmed they are the same character, she is nearly identical in appearance to the character [[Eua (higurashi)|]] from the anime [[Higurashi No Naku Koro Ni]] Gou.

title: alice_mana
body:
Korean [[Indie virtual youtuber]] formerly part of [[paryi project]] and Korean VTuber group [[541 E&C]] (which later became a part of [[Nijisanji KR]], the merger prompting her departure). A monochrome [[kitsune]] with [[multicolored_hair|muticolored]] [[twintails]] dressed in traditional [[Japanese clothes]] that can switch from black to white and vice versa with multiple tails of the same colors (her original design she had two. Her redesign has four.).  

She originally debuted on May 9th, 2018. Her artist was [[paryi]] (when she was with 541 E&C her design was by Moarin) but on July 12, 2020 she re-debuted back on YouTube after previously streaming only on [[bilibili]] and [[twitch.tv]]. Her new design was drawn by [[nabi (uz02)|Nabi]] and her new rigging by [[keffiy]].

Interestingly, she has stated herself to be 315 years old yet her birthday falls on February 29, which is considered a "leap year":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leap_year

title: henry_rifle
body:
The progenitor of the more famous [[Winchester model 1866|Winchester rifles]], the Henry Repeating Rifle can be readily identified from them visually by the lack of a side-mounted loading gate, lack of a wooden forward stock, and yellow-colored bronze/brass alloy receiver. Though the Henry was used in some numbers during the [[American Civil War]] and the [[Boshin War]], the weapon would make its deepest mark in the American west, where it played a crucial role in the Battle of Little Bighorn.

* !post #8560683: A view of the various distinguishing features of the Henry. 

h4. See also
* [[Winchester Model 1866]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

title: flash
body:
[b]As of March 31, 2021, uploading flash files is no longer possible.[/b] See forum #183397 for details.

This tag is for games, [[music video]]s, and [[animated|animations]] created using Adobe Flash.

While Flash enjoyed success from the late 1990s to the late 2000s (especially because of the failure of the Java platform in the web), it eventually declined as JavaScript and other browser-agnostic platforms like HTML5 and WebGL matured. Adobe, recognizing that Flash lost its relevance over time, announced in 2017 that in-browser Flash plugins would no longer be supported after December 2020; all major browsers permanently removed Flash support by the end of January 2021.

During its lifetime, Adobe made a change to the Flash player after version 9 that broke many older files. As of now, the 51 posts with this tag have been fixed by flipping a flag in the header, as detailed in topic #15331, but if such a file was found, it was recommended to try and view it in version 9's stand-alone player.

As of March 2021, Danbooru is set up to automatically load all Flash posts using Ruffle.js, which uses "WebAssembly":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WebAssembly] to emulate Flash in modern browsers as a part of the broader "Ruffle Project":[https://ruffle.rs]. While this means you can view Flash posts without falling back on an outdated browser that's old enough to still support the original Flash Player, please keep in mind that Ruffle's core emulation of Flash [b]is still in an alpha state[/b] and it's less likely to work with files that are newer and/or more complex. See [[ruffle compatible]] for posts that have been manually confirmed to work with the version of Ruffle.js that Danbooru is currently using.

h4. See also

* [[sound]]
* [[audible music]]
* [[audible speech]]
* [[Tag group:Image composition]]
* [[Adobe Flash]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Adobe Flash Player":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adobe_Flash_Player]
* "Ruffle: Official website":[https://ruffle.rs]

title: colt_1860_army
body:
A .44 caliber cap and ball [[revolver]] designed by Samuel Colt in the 1850s, and the most common pistol used in the [[American Civil War]]. It uses the same frame as the [[Colt 1851 Navy]], but is visually distinguished by its larger size, and circular barrel as opposed to the 1851's hexagonal barrel.

title: em-2
body:
A prototype [[bullpup]] [b][[assault rifle]][/b] chambered in .280 British intermediate [[ammunition|cartridge]], the EM-2 was seriously considered for adoption by the [[British Army]] in the 1950s but was abandoned after NATO mandated all its members' rifles use the 7.62mm cartridge, which was too powerful for the EM-2 platform to contain. The [[weapon]] features a fixed [[optical sight]] on the carry [[handle]], wooden furniture, and a bulged handguard. 
Its design eventually influenced the [[L85|SA80]] [[rifle]].

In anime, the EM-2 is most often seen wielded by members of the [[Justice Task Force (Blue Archive)|Justice Task Force]] in [[Blue Archive]].

h1. See also
* [[EM-2 (Girls' Frontline)]]

title: david_8
body:
A character from the 2012 [[science fiction]] horror film [[prometheus_(movie)|Prometheus]] that also appears in the [[Alien: Covenant]] sequel movie from 2017. He is played by Irish-German actor [[Michael Fassbender]].

[b]David 8[/b] is an advanced male [[android]] that serves as an assistant and servant to the crew of the [[USCSS Prometheus]]. He was developed by the [[weyland-yutani|Weyland Corporation]].

title: flip-flops
body:
A type of casual [[sandals|sandal]], consisting of a flat sole held loosely on the foot by a Y-shaped strap known as a toe thong that passes between the first and second toes and around both sides of the foot.

h4. Examples

* !post #4286683

h4. See also

* [[la chancla]]
* [[slides]]
* [[sandals]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flip-flops":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flip-flops]

title: slides
body:
A type of open-toed slide-on [[sandals|sandal]] that features a single strap across the top of the foot. They are similar to [[flip-flops]], but their strap goes over the toes instead of between them.

Compared to [[slippers]], which cover the toes and are normally worn indoors, slides don't cover the toes and are often used outdoors.

h4. Examples

* !post #8067277

h4. See also

* [[high heel slides]]
* [[flip-flops]]
* [[sandals]]
* [[slippers]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Slide":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slide_(footwear)]

title: sandals
body:
An open type of footwear, consisting of a sole held to the wearer's foot by straps or thongs passing over the instep and around the ankle.

Sandals are typically worn without [[socks]]. For sandals worn with socks, search {{sandals socks}}.

h4. See also

* [[flip-flops]]
* [[geta]]
* [[paduka]]
* [[okobo]]
* [[slides]]
* [[slippers]]
* [[waraji]]
* [[zouri]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]
other_names: รองเท้าแตะ

title: fairy_tail:_houou_no_miko
body: The first movie based on the [[Fairy Tail]].

title: cragalanche
body: A boss fought on Chapter 11 of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]]. He is a large, sentient [[rock]] that acts as an enforcer of [[Viridi]]'s Forces of Nature. He has a weak spot on his backside.

title: dog_(kid_icarus)
body: The dog is a minor character that appears in the Chapter 18 of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]]. [[pit_(kid_icarus)|Pit]] briefly takes control of its body when his soul is trapped in the Ring of Chaos before taking control of [[magnus (kid icarus)|Magnus]].

title: magnus_(kid_icarus)
body:
A supporting character from [[Kid Icarus Uprising]], described as the most powerful human warrior who ever lived. His weapon of choice is the [[Magnus Club (kid_icarus)|]].
He befriends [[Pit (kid_icarus)|]] in Chapter 2, becomes playable temporarily in Chapter 18, and is fought along with [[Gaol]] in Chapter 24.

title: arlon_(kid_icarus)
body: A boss fought on Chapter 13 of [[Kid Icarus Uprising]]. He is one of the commanders of [[Viridi]]'s Forces of Nature and carries out his duties from the Lunar Sanctrum, an artificial moon. His design resembles a [[butler]].

title: kid_icarus
body:

* [[Kid Icarus Of Myths and Monsters]] (Game Boy)

title: koihime_musou
body:
[b]Koihime Musou: Doki Otome Darake no Sangokushi Engi[/b] (lit. [i]Love Princess†Unmatched ~Throb☆Romance of Three Kingdoms Filled with Girls~[/i]) is a Japanese adult visual novel and strategy game based on the classic Chinese novel [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]].

It was developed by [i]BaseSon[/i], and was first released on January 26, 2007, for the PC as two DVD-ROMs, followed by a re-release on April 11, 2008, containing an extra CD-ROM. A [[PlayStation 2]] version, titled [i]Koihime Musou[/i] (恋姫†夢想) developed by [i]Yeti[/i] and published by [i]Regista[/i] was released on October 30, 2008. A new version of [i]Koihime[/i] with many new characters titled [i]Shin Koihime Musou: Otome Ryouran Sangokushi Engi[/i] (真・恋姫†無双 〜乙女繚乱☆三国志演義〜) was released on December 26, 2008. A third version titled [i]Shin Koihime Musou: Moe Shouden[/i] (真・恋姫†無双～萌将伝～) was released on July 23, 2010.

A manga adaptation by Japanese illustrator [[Hizuki Yayoi]] was first serialized in the Japanese magazine [i]Dengeki G's Festival! Comic[/i] on April 26, 2008. An anime adaptation produced by [i]Doga Kobo[/i] began broadcasting on July 8, 2008, and several seasons have continued.

All characters are loosely based on characters of the novel [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]] and are grouped in the faction/kingdom they belong to and called by their Japanese names.

title: hohojiro-san_(lain_paterson)
body:
[[Lain Paterson]]'s [[shark]]-shaped [[ammunition pouch|ammo pouch]].  
It can hold just about anything, like a four-dimensional pocket, and items are taken out through its mouth.  
It has its own will and sometimes even speaks.  
According to [[Lack]]-Papa, it can also serve as a heater, and it can float.

title: loafers
body:
A slip on [[shoes|dress shoe]] with a flat broad heel. Created in the most basic color of brown and black, and worn by both genders. Worn quite often with [[casual|casual clothing]], [[business suit|business suits]], and [[school uniform|school uniforms]].

Not to be confused with [[mary janes]], which have a strap running over an open top.
Not to be confused with [[uwabaki]], which is the Japanese school indoor shoes.

title: mary_janes
body:
A style of women's [[shoes]] characterized by a single strap across the top of the foot in place of laces or a zipper. Usually [[black footwear|black]], short-heeled or flat, and very smooth-featured, with a simple buckle to hold the strap tight. Commonly seen on [[school uniform]]s, [[lolita fashion]], and fetish porn stars.

Not to be confused with [[loafers]] which can also have a strap but running over a leather top. See the example post

Not to be confused with [[uwabaki]], which is the Japanese school indoor shoes.

title: solar_term
body:
A [b]solar term[/b] (or jiéqì, simplified Chinese: 节气; traditional Chinese: 節氣) is any of 24 periods in traditional Chinese calendars that matches a particular astronomical event or signifies some natural phenomenon. It originated in China, then spread to Korea, Vietnam, and Japan, countries in the East Asian cultural sphere.
Term Chinese (Trad./Simp.) Japanese Date (± 1 day)
Lichun 立春 Feb 4
Yushui 雨水 Feb 19
Jingzhe 驚蟄/惊蛰 啓蟄 Mar 6
Chunfen 春分 [tn]Vernal equinox[/tn] Mar 21
[[Qingming Festival|Qingming]] 清明 Apr 5
Guyu 穀雨/谷雨 Apr 20
Lixia 立夏 May 6
Xiaoman 小滿/小满 小満 May 21
Mangzhong 芒種/芒种 Jun 6
Xiazhi 夏至 [tn]Summer solstice[/tn] Jun 21
Xiaoshu 小暑 Jul 7
Dashu 大暑 Jul 23
Liqiu 立秋 Aug 8
Chushu 處暑/处暑 処暑 Aug 23
Bailu 白露 Sep 8
Qiufen 秋分 [tn]Autumnal equinox[/tn] Sep 23
Hanlu 寒露 Oct 8
Shuangjiang 霜降 Oct 23
Lidong 立冬 Nov 7
Xiaoxue 小雪 Nov 22
Daxue 大雪 Dec 7
Dongzhi 冬至 [tn]Winter solstice[/tn] Dec 22
Xiaohan 小寒 Jan 6
Dahan 大寒 Jan 20
h4. External links * "Wikipedia: Solar term":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_term

title: mudrock_(arknights)
body:
[i]Mudrock, Sarkaz mercenary, old friend of the fertile soil and stone.[/i]

A playable Defender Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazdel[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]September 21[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sarkaz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]163 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]4 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Formerly a part of the Reunion Movement, Mudrock led her team far from Ursus after disagreements with the organization. She had no involvement with Reunion whatsoever during the incidents in Chernobog and Lungmen. Searching for a foothold to establish, Mudrock took her team towards Leithania. After taking in a great number of Leithanien Infected there, Mudrock became a highly esteemed leader, and her team came to be known as the [i]Mudrock Squad[/i].

Despite Mudrock's multiple attempts to avoid conflict with other powers, her side was nevertheless drawn into constant disputes. So as to prevent any further meaningless sacrifice, she headed to Kazdel and after coming into contact with an elite operator named Logos, she departed for Rhodes Island.

She and her squad are antagonists of the side story event [i]Twilight of Wolumonde[/i].

Uses a [[sledgehammer]]-styled [[war hammer]] during combat. Her [[voice actor]] is [[Uchida Maaya]].

h4. Skins

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with a [[black hair|black]] [[streaked hair|streak]] in the front, [[purple eyes]], [[pointy ears]], a [[skin fang]] and [[skin-covered horns]]] with a [[purple horns|purple]] [[gradient horns|horns]]. She also has a [[mole under mouth|mole under her mouth]] and on [[mole on thigh|her right thigh]] and has [[thick eyebrows]] shaved into [[hikimayu]].

Her default hairstyle is [[short hair with long locks]] with [[crossed bangs]] [[hair between eyes|reaching between her eyes]], [[sidelocks]] held with black [[hair tubes]], and a large [[crescent hair ornament]] with [[hairpin]]s and a [[purple_ribbon|purple]] [[hair_ribbon|ribbon]].

title: takasugi_shinsaku_(fate)
body: [[Fate/Grand Order]] character. A central figure in the early Meiji Restoration during the 1860s, who put all his efforts into opening the way to modernization, westernization and reforms, not only in military matters but in political and social matters as well. He died of tuberculosis at only 28 years old.

title: izumo_no_okuni_(fate)
body: Caster-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. A shrine maiden credited as the progenitor of kabuki dance. One story claims that Okuni performed a show based on Nagoya Sansaburou, and her singing voice lured his spirit back to perform a dance with her. He is summoned with her as [[Zanzaburou (fate)|]], a heavily-armored samurai who attacks with her.

title: horikawa_kunihiro
body:
A [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] character, the personification of the historical [[wakizashi]] [i]Horikawa Kunihiro[/i]. 
Character design by [[shiramine (srmn09)|Shiramine]], voiced by [[Enoki Jun'ya]]. 

Both he and [[Izumi-no-Kami Kanesada]] are personifications of swords that belonged to [[Hijikata Toshizou]]. He as a character is named after his swordsmith, as the sword he was based on went unnamed. After the Japanese surrendered in WWII, he was one of the 200,000 swords confiscated and dumped at sea. Only about 5600 were recovered, but his whereabouts were unknown and it is unlikely he's still around to this day. 

He has short [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears a blue [[double-breasted]] jacket with a red [[ribbon]], [[white pants]], and red [[stud earrings]]. In his Kiwame form, he wears a [[white scarf]], a black coat and black [[knee boots]]. For Internal Affairs, he wears a red [[track suit]].

Major player in [i][[Katsugeki/Touken Ranbu]][/i].

h4. Costumes
* !post #1934104: Base art
* !post #1934103: Track suit
* !post #2855694: [[Horikawa Kunihiro (kiwame)|Kiwame form]]

title: narukami_arashi
body: Character in [i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i]. 2nd Year student of Yumenosaki high school and member of [[Knights (ensemble_stars!)|]]. Has a friendly demeanor. title: tornado
body: A weather phenomenon characterized by a concentrated, rotating mass of air producing powerful, often damaging winds. In nature, tornadoes are normally spawned from severe thunderstorms or tropical cyclones under specific, complex meteorological conditions. While tornadoes can spawn virtually anywhere in the world, they are most common in America, with the majority occurring in two principal areas: Tornado Alley, famously stretching across the plains of the central US, and Dixie Alley, comprising portions of the American southeast. In fiction, tornadoes can be deliberately spawned by individuals or devices capable of controlling the wind or weather.

title: gien_(koihime_musou)
body:
[[koihime_musou|Koihime Musou]] interpretation of Wei Yan (魏延), style name Wenchang (文長).

In KM, she uses the personal name Yanye (焔耶, read as "En'ya" in Japanese). She is Ryuubi's bodyguard and easily distinguished by her black hair with white streaks on the right side. Has a tomboyish personality and seems to take exception to any kind of behavior that suggests affection or attraction, whether from people, or animals (such as [[Ryofu (koihime musou)|]]'s dogs). Initially hostile towards Kazuto and thinks of him as a perverted troublemaker, until she is "punished" by Batai in a very humiliating way (Batai tricked Gien into a well prepared snare trap, and then tickled her). At first denying it, she eventually realizes she likes Kazuto.

title: lu_bu
body:
[b]Lü Bu[/b] (吕布), courtesy name [b]Fengxian[/b] (奉先), was a Chinese military general, politician, and warlord who lived during the late [[Han Dynasty|Eastern Han dynasty]] of [[Chinese empire|Imperial China]]. He is often depicted as wearing a golden [[headdress]] with pheasant [[feathers]] and riding his horse, [[Red Hare]] while wielding a [[Fangtian Ji]].

Originally a subordinate of a minor warlord [[Ding Yuan]], he betrayed and murdered Ding Yuan and defected to [[Dong Zhuo]] in the early 190s. In 192, he turned against Dong Zhuo and killed him after being instigated by [[Wang Yun]] and [[Shisun Rui]] (fictionalized using [[Diao Chan]]), but was later defeated and driven away by Dong Zhuo's followers.

From 192 to early 195, Lü Bu wandered around central and northern China, consecutively seeking shelter under warlords such as [[Yuan Shu]], [[Yuan Shao]], and [[Zhang Yang]]. In 194, he managed to take control of Yan Province from the warlord [[Cao Cao]], but Cao took back his territories within two years. In 195, Lü Bu turned against [[Liu Bei]], who had offered him refuge in Xu Province, and seized control of the province from his host. Although he had agreed to an alliance with Yuan Shu earlier, he severed ties with him after Yuan declared himself emperor and joined Cao and others in attacking the pretender. However, in 198, he sided with Yuan Shu again and came under attack by the combined forces of Cao and Liu, resulting in his defeat at the Battle of Xiapi in 199. He was captured and executed by strangulation on Cao's order.

Although Lü Bu is described in historical and fictional sources as a nearly unchallenged and peerless warrior, he was also notorious for his unstable behaviour and brutish/ruthless behavior. He switched allegiances erratically and freely betrayed his allies. He was always suspicious of others and could not control his subordinates. All these factors  eventually became the reason of his downfall.

h4. See also

* [[Lu Bu (Shin Sangoku Musou)|]] ([[Shin Sangoku Musou]])
* [[Ryofu (koihime musou)|]] ([[Koihime Musou]])
* [[Ryofu Housen ]] ([[Ikkitousen]])

title: senran_kagura_peach_beach_splash
body:
[b]SENRAN KAGURA: Peach Beach Splash[/b] ([b]閃乱カグラ PEACH BEACH SPLASH[/b]) is a multiplayer third person shooting game in the [[Senran Kagura]] series, published by [[Marvelous]] and developed by Honey∞Parade Games. It was released for the Playstation 4 on March 16, 2017, and for Windows on Steam, March 8, 2018.

Rather than the [[ninja]]-based action of its predecessors, the game features a [[water gun]] tournament where the winner is promised whatever they want as their reward. 

While the game was designed to unite all characters from the previous games into one central storyline, the cast includes several [[crossover|crossovers]] from other collaborations as well.

title: ryofu_(koihime_musou)
body:
Called a monster by others due to her ridiculous strength. In truth, she simply wishes to live peacefully with her pets, of which she has about fifty of. She loves Kazuto, but initially does not understand the feeling she experiences. When she eats, people who look at her cannot help but stare in awe. In the sequel, Shin Koihime Musō, she joins forces with the Shu kingdom and accompany by [[Chinkyu]].

Her real name is Ren and a real-counterpart of Lu Bu.

References: [[Lu Bu]], [[Ryofu Housen]]; [[Koihime Musou]]

title: dong_zhuo
body:
(Courtesy name: 仲穎/仲颖, Zhongying)

A Chinese warlord who lived in the late Eastern Han Dynasty. He was depicted as a selfish tyrant in Luo Guanzhong's [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms]].

He appeared in almost all of the Three Kingdoms-themed games as an antagonist in the early part. On danbooru, the Japanese reading of his name, [[Toutaku (koihime musou)|]], is currently used for a character in [[Koihime Musou]].

h4.External Link

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dong_Zhuo]

title: kaku_bunwa_(koihime_musou)
body: Koihime Musou character based on Dong Zhuo, Lü Bu, and then Cao Cao's advisor Jia Xu. Her style name is Bunwa, and her true name is Ei. She is [[Toutaku (koihime musou)|]]'s best childhood friend.

title: toutaku_(koihime_musou)
body:
A character in [[Koihime Musou]]. The Governess of Dong province. However unlike her real life counterpart, who was a tyrannical and cruel man, she is a kind, sweet, timid and innocent girl who wants to help her country and her people no matter the circumstance. Due to her innocent personality, most are unable to say no to her as they are too helpless against her innocent pleas.

In the remake [[Shin Koihime Musou]], she joins forces with the Shu kingdom, becoming one of the strategists.

Her real name is Yue, she is the real life counter-part of [[Dong Zhuo]] who is a tyrannical and cruel man.

title: shuutai_(koihime_musou)
body:
An officer in the sequel, Shin Koihime Musō. Despite her small size she's a skillful warrior, wielding a sword that's as long as she is tall. She's quite fond of cats. She develops a huge crush on Kazuto, to the point of blushing profusely when the other members of the Wu faction tease her about it.

Her real name is Minmei and the real counter-part of Zhou Tai in real life.

title: sun_ce
body:
[b]Sun Ce[/b] (孫策) (175 – 5 May 200), courtesy name [b]Bofu[/b], was a Chinese military general, politician, and warlord who lived during the late [[Han dynasty|Eastern Han dynasty]] of [[Chinese Empire|China]]. He was the eldest child of [[Sun Jian]], who was killed during the Battle of Xiangyang when Sun Ce was only 16. Sun Ce then broke away from his father's overlord, [[Yuan Shu]], and headed to the Jiangdong region in southern China to establish his own power base there. With the help of several people, such as [[Zhang Zhao]] and [[Zhou Yu]], Sun Ce managed to lay down the foundation of the state of [[Eastern Wu]] during the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms|Three Kingdoms period]].

In 200, when the warlord [[Cao Cao]] was at war with his rival [[Yuan Shao]] in the Battle of Guandu, Sun Ce was rumoured to be planning an attack on Xuchang, Cao Cao's base. However, he was assassinated before he could carry out the plan. Sun Ce was posthumously honoured as "Prince Huan of Changsha" (長沙桓王) by his younger brother [[Sun Quan]] when the latter became the founding emperor of Eastern Wu. 

h4. See also

* [[Sun Ce (Shin Sangoku Musou)|]] ([[Shin Sangoku Musou]])

title: gengan_(koihime_musou)
body:
[[koihime_musou|Koihime Musou]] interpretation of Yan Yan. 

A general of Shoku and Kouchuu's close friend and drinking partner. In the anime, she is a female federal lord that was the teacher to Gien, she decommissioned her from straining the promise that Gien would not draw her sword. Even though she has duties as a federal lord, she does do some leisurely activities ranging from drinking alcohol to attending and betting on horse races

title: zhao_yun
body:
[b]Zhao Yun[/b] (趙雲) (died 229), courtesy name [b]Zilong[/b] (子龍), was a military general who lived during the late [[Han Dynasty|Eastern Han dynasty]] and early [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms|Three Kingdoms period]] of [[Chinese Empire|China]]. Originally a subordinate of the northern warlord [[Gongsun Zan]], Zhao Yun later came to serve another warlord, [[Liu Bei]], and had since accompanied him on most of his military exploits, from the Battle of Changban (208) to the Hanzhong Campaign (217–219). He continued serving in the state of [[Shu Han]] – founded by Liu Bei in 221 – in the Three Kingdoms period and participated in the first of the Northern Expeditions until his death in 229. Along with [[Guan Yu]], [[Ma Chao]], [[Zhang Fei]], [[Huang Zhong]], he is considered a member of the [[Five Tiger Generals]].

h5. Adaptations in popular culture:
* [[Shin Sangoku Musou]] (Dynasty Warriors) 
* [[chouun (koihime musou)|Sei]] from [[Koihime Musou]]
* [[Chouun Shiryuu]] from [[Ikkitousen]]

title: chouun_(koihime_musou)
body:
Based on: Zhao Yun
Style name: Shiryuu
True name: Sei

She joins to the Shoku when Kan'u was fighting the Tō army, she fought alongside Chō'un for a while; when this war ended, Chō'un met Kazuto and took a liking to him, promising to join his army later. She joins alongside Kōchū after the battle with Enshō. She has a strong obsession of "menma":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menma. She also has a habit of running around the city as the masked hero of justice 'Butterfly Mask'. Strangely, no one other than Kazuto and Shuri can recognize her true identity, despite only wearing a mask.

title: chouhi_ekitoku
body:
Chouhi Ekitoku (張飛 益德): Zhang Fei - Yide
(Zhang Fei a strong fighter of Shu, one of Shu Five Tiger Generals)
Voiced by: Minori Chihara (Japanese), , Jessica Calvello (English)

Manga version
Ryuubi's best friend and an avid snack-lover. Although quite weak and only a C-rank, history states that she will one day become so powerful that legends will tell of her matching ten thousand men (just like Zhang Fei, himself), which makes her well-known around town. She has already performed such a feat, although on a much smaller scale, when Kyosho first assaulted Seito to search for Ryubi. Myosai almost killed her during their fight but she was luckily saved by Chou-un. She is currently out of action, recovering from the serious injuries suffered in the fight against Myosai. Ryubi is staying by her side.

Anime version
She is more bossy in the anime. She is frustrated that Ryubi is not the powerful toushi she is meant to be as Seito's leader. Despite that, she is still best friends with Ryubi and Kanu. She is strong enough to throw Kanu several stories into the air (probably representing Zhang Fei's roar at Changban when the Shu forces were retreating from Cao Cao). At the end of the series she is seen in a restaurant with Kouchu. The two could now be a couple.

Not confused with [[Chouhi (koihime musou)|Chouhi Ekitoku]] from [[Koihime Musou]] series and the [[Zhang Fei (romance Of The Three Kingdoms)|historical figure]].

title: chouhi_(koihime_musou)
body:
Chōhi Yokutoku (張飛 翼徳, Zhang Fei - Yide)
Real name: Rinrin (鈴々, Lingling)
Voiced by: Miya Serizono (visual novel), Hiroka Nishizawa (anime)

Visual novel version
Chōhi joins Kazuto along with Kan'u after the two discover him together. Unlike Kan'u, who holds a more reserved Master-servant-like relationship with Kazuto, she treats Kazuto like an older sibling and calls him "big brother," similar to how she treats Kan'u. As a powerful character, Chōhi has the strongest Damage ability when used as a general in the game. However, she has no defense technique when used as a commander, thus making her unfit to be one.

Anime version
Chōhi is a talkative and always cheerful girl. Although she is small and very smart in some things, she is naive in others, yet very powerful and strong. She is one of the main characters and the first person to join Kan'u. Chōhi will also be very dedicated to her duty no matter what the cost to her (in one episode, for example, she fights bandits despite having a cold.) During the second season, she was opposed of Ryūbi of becoming Kan'u little sister as Chōhi was already made a vow with Kan'u to be her little sister but accepted when Ryūbi decides to make Kan'u her little sister instead. By the third season, she has accepted Ryūbi as her other older sister and even calling her Touka nee-chan.

Not confused with [[Chouhi Ekitoku]] from [[Ikkitousen]] series and the [[Zhang Fei (romance Of The Three Kingdoms)|historical figure]].

title: liu_bei
body:
[b]Liu Bei[/b] (劉備), courtesy name [b]Xuande[/b] (玄德), was a Chinese warlord in the [[Han dynasty|late Eastern Han dynasty]] who later became the founding emperor of [[Shu Han]], one of the [[Romance of the Three Kingdoms|Three Kingdoms of China]]. He is commonly depicted as tall with big ears. Thanks to [i]Romance of the Three Kingdoms[/i], Liu Bei is widely regarded as the ideal benevolent and humane ruler who cared for his people and selected good advisers for his government, which attracts to his side many capable and heroic subordinates like [[Guan Yu]], [[Zhang Fei]], [[Zhao Yun]], [[Zhuge Liang]], and [[Pang Tong]].

Although he was a distant relative of the Han imperial family, he grew up poor and impoverished, selling shoes and straw mats. He studied under [[Lu Zhi]] with [[Gongsan Zan]]. He gathered a militia army to fight the [[Yellow Turbans]] with [[Guan Yu]] and [[Zhang Fei]], later participating in the coalition against [[Dong Zhuo]]. Following this, he joined his childhood friend Gongsun Zan and fought under him against [[Yuan Shao]], who then sent him to help [[Tao Qian]] against [[Cao Cao]]. Thanks to the support of the influential Mi and Chen families along with Tao Qian's last will, Liu Bei inherited the Xu Province. After his defeat against Cao Cao, [[Lu Bu|Lü Bu]] joined him, but betrayed him with Yuan Shu and seized Xu Province. Later Liu Bei joined Cao Cao and they defeated Lü Bu at the Battle of Xiapi. Although he was treated well by Cao Cao, Liu Bei received a secret edict from the emperor to kill Cao Cao and rebelled. After a brief alliance with Yuan Shao, Liu Bei was quickly defeated by Cao Cao and had to fflee. He was sent by Yuan Shao to create uprisings behind Cao Cao's main base, and later joined his kinsman [[Liu Biao]]. After Liu Biao's death, Liu Bei and his supporters joined [[Liu Qi]] in Xiakou where they allied with [[Sun Quan]]. Together they opposed Cao Cao at the Battle of Red Cliffs.

After Cao Cao's defeat, Liu Bei quickly took control of the majority of Jing Province and married Sun Quan's sister. Sun Quan then agreed to "lend" him Nan Commandery. Liu Bei later led his army to join another kinsman, [[Liu Zhang]], in his war against the warlord [[Zhang Lu]]. Based on the advice of his advisors, Liu Bei betrayed Liu Zhang and seized the Yi Province from him, before declaring himself "King of Hanzhong" and setting up his headquarters in Chengdu. However soon after [[Guan Yu]] was killed by Liu Bei's "ally" Sun Quan who took the rest of Jing province. Liu Bei was furious and led his army against his former ally but was defeated by [[Lu Xun]]. Ashamed by his failure, he never returned to Chengdu and settled in Baidicheng where he died one year later. He urged his heir, [[Liu Shan]] not to emulate him and rather be as virtuous as possible. Before he died Liu Bei appointed Zhuge Liang to advise his son on domestic matters with Li Yan to advise him on the military matters. 

h4. See also

* [[Liu Bei (Shin Sangoku Musou)|]] ([[Shin Sangoku Musou]])
* [[Ryuubi (koihime musou)|]] ([[Koihime Musou]])
* [[Ryuubi Gentoku]] ([[Ikkitousen]])

title: half-harpy
body:
A [[monster girl]] with significant bird-like features but lacks the definitive features of a [[harpy]], namely [[winged arms]]. Most characters having wings on the back—including [[low wings]]—in addition to other bird features, such as [[animal feet]], qualify for this tag instead of [[bird girl]]. Characters without wings at all may qualify if they're bird-like to the point of reasonably qualifying for [[monster girl]] (see post #6603555).

* !post #3759623: [[Meidri]], the prototypical form.

title: ultima_(tensura)
body:
Ultima takes the appearance of a cute and beautiful girl. She has  middle length [[purple hair]] tied into a [[side ponytail]], as well as purple fingernails. When she's off the clock she wears a variety of purple-colored dresses as casual wear and when she's serious she wears a black skirted military uniform with an armband on her left arm.

As a Demon, she has the characteristic horns and wings of their race, something she usually keeps hidden. She has six bat-like wings on her back that she can freely shapeshift into whatever she desires.

title: shion_(tensura)
body:
Voiced by: M.A.O (Japanese); Michelle Rojas (English)
Shion is a well endowed female ogre who is also a terrible cook. One of the six survivors of the ogre village. She becomes Rimuru's (self-appointed) secretary and bodyguard after evolving into a kijin and shares a rivalry with Shuna for Rimuru's attention. She is a great fighter, but often speaks out of turn, comically forcing Rimuru to take action to save face. She was given the simple title "Warrior" after the Orc Lord's defeat.

title: waha
body:
Chibi version of [[Yamato Suzuran]] created by [[Futaba Channel]]'s Nijiura board. She is named after Suzuran's common exclamation of "Waha!" Her older sister is [[Musu]] and her "pet human" is [[Choia]]. 

Waha is a very well-established and popular character on the board, and a [[meme]] in and of herself. Many parodies exist of her staple "Waha!" pose.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24538399

h4. See also

* [[Waha~ (meme)|]]

title: waha~_(meme)
body:
"Waha~" is a meme that was widely prevalent on 2chan and 4chan's /b/ and /jp/ boards from roughly 2002. It featured a [[chibi]] version of [[Yamato Suzuran]] dubbed [[Waha]] from the hentai game [[Suigetsu]] with her arms either [[outstretched arms|outstretched]] or in a [[\o/]] sort of pose, saying the titular "Waha~" phrase.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Yamato Suzuran (Waha!)":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/yamato-suzuran-waha]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Waha-":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E3%82%8F%E3%81%AF%E3%83%BC]

title: eversoul
body:
A Korean 3D idle gacha game developed by NINEARK and published by Kakao Games. 

"Initially titled [i]Soul Artifact[/i]":[https://mmoculture.com/2020/08/soul-artifact-kakao-signs-global-publishing-rights-for-new-mobile-rpg/] following its announcement in August 2020, 
"it was renamed to [i]Eversoul[/i]":[https://mmoculture.com/2021/07/eversoul-mobile-rpg-under-kakao-games-gets-a-new-name-and-art/] the following year. With an initial release window of December 2022, it would be quietly pushed back to January 5, 2023, releasing globally sans China, and subsequently released in Japan on May 29, 2024. 

h4. Synopsis
"Eversoul" tells the story of the Savior, a young man from modern-day Earth, being summoned to the world of Eden, an alternate Earth set in the distant future after the extinction of mankind, to become its hero and lead the immortal Souls in the fight against an unknown enemy wreaking havoc across their once-peaceful world.

h4. Known artist/s who worked on Eversoul / with NINEARK
* [[ankkoyom]] (NINEARK employee until November 2024 due to health issues)
* [[dramz]] (select characters)

h4. See also
[[List of Eversoul characters]]

h4. Official links
* "Global official site.":[https://eversoul.kakaogames.com/]
* "Japanese official site.":[https://jp-eversoul.kakaogames.com/]

title: iktomisaurus_(genshin_impact)
body:
A creature in [[genshin_impact|Genshin Impact]].

A type of Saurian found in Natlan. They can leap to great heights, glide, have the ability to use Cryo blasts, and have enhanced sensory abilities that allow them to manifest objects from graffiti. The Masters of the Night-Wind tribe is most closely associated with them.

Iktomisaurs are mostly blue and white in color, with blue eyes and orange highlights under their eyes. They have cape-like feathers that extend from their shoulders, used for gliding. They have tall and slender builds, are bipedal, stand on two [[talons]], and have very large ears that extend over the top of their heads.

title: qucusaurus_(genshin_impact)
body:
A creature in [[genshin_impact|Genshin Impact]].

A type of Saurian found in Natlan. They are capable of flight, and can spit fire. The Flower-Feather Clan tribe is most closely associated with them.

Qucusaurs are primarily bright pink and white in color, with red and yellow eyes. They are bipedal, and stand on two [[talons]]. They also have two wings and long tail feathers. Adult Qucusaurs are covered in feathers and have a single [[ahoge]]-like feather on their heads; young Qucusaurs lack these feathers and ahoge.

title: wood-burning_stove
body: A [[stove]] designed to operate by burning [[firewood]] as fuel for the heating element(s). Typically constructed of iron, but potentially with fire bricks as an additional material, these are usually on legs or some other sort of base to prevent fire risk, and for similar reasons there is usually a gap with the nearest wall.

title: suzutsuki_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Suzutsuki[/i]. Character design by [[Shisantian]].

She is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[brown eyes]], possessing both normal human ears and [[animal ears]]. Her default outfit consists of a golden crow [[mask]], [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] white [[print kimono]] top with red ties and a [[fur collar]], black [[obi]], [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], black [[socks]]/[[tabi]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her rigging consists of a hull piece around her waist containing her 610 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]], and a floating 10 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP gun mount]] on top of a [[shimenawa]].

h4. History
The real-life Suzutsuki participated in the ill-fated [[Operation Ten-Gou|Operation Ten-Go]], but she survived (despite extensive damage), along [[hatsushimo (azur lane)|Hatsushimo]], [[yukikaze (azur lane)|Yukikaze]], and Fuyutsuki. After the war she, along with Fuyutsuki, became part of a breakwater in Takamatsu in November 1945. Due to extensive repairs after typhoon damage in 1961 their hulls are completely buried.

title: sheffield_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the cruiser HMS [i]Sheffield[/i] (C24).

She has [[blonde_hair|blonde]] [[hair rings]] framing dull [[yellow eyes]] and pale skin. Like many other Royal Navy light cruisers, she is a [[maid]]. Her outfit is much more modest, revealing no cleavage like many other Royal maids, with a [[cross]] hanging from her neck. Her breasts are usually portrayed as smaller than her counterparts, though she bears no envy over it.

Unlike the other maids, Sheffield is much more serious about her duties and is very sharp-tongued and caustic towards the [[Commander_(azur_lane)|]]. She refuses to give into the lewd antics that the others (such as [[Sirius_(azur_lane)|]]) finds themselves involved in. She also specializes in espionage and special operations duties, emphasized in the anime, which also reveals her somewhat ironic status as a [[no_panties|different breed of commando]].

Character design by [[Maya G]], voiced by [[Kohara Konomi]].

h4. History

In real life, [i]Sheffield[/i] was the third of the [[Southampton (Azur Lane)|]]-class light cruisers, the first group of the Town-class. She earned the nickname "Shiny Sheff" on account of the fact that her interior fittings were done in stainless steel instead of brass, rare in the [[Royal Navy]].

She took part in the sinking of [[Bismarck (Azur Lane)|]], Arctic convoys, the battles of the Barents Sea and North Cape, the Salerno landings, and [[Victorious (Azur Lane)|]]' attempts to sink [[Tirpitz (Azur Lane)|]]. Consequently, she attained 12 battle honours.

Post-war, consideration was given to turn her to a museum ship as she largely remained unchanged from her war years but she had deteriorated in reserve so [[Belfast (Azur Lane)|]] was selected instead. She was scrapped in 1967.

title: seydlitz_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Imperial German battlecruiser SMS [i]Seydlitz[/i]. 
[tn]Not to be confused with the later Kriegsmarine heavy cruiser [i]Seydlitz[/i], who was converted to a light carrier as [[Weser (Azur Lane)|]].[/tn] 
Character design by [[Hou (ppo)|]], voiced by [[Tsuda Minami]].

h4. Appearance

In-game, she is portrayed with [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes]], while wearing a [[peaked cap]], [[double-breasted]] two-tone [[military uniform]] with [[epaulettes]], and a [[black cape]]. She is also shown wielding a [[sword]]. Her rig is themed with the rest of Ironblood, with her five 28 cm twin gun mounts placed on animalistic rigs: one each to her side, one to her left, two her right.

h4. History
In real life, [i]Seydlitz[/i] was a one-off battlecruiser born out of Imperial Navy Department requests for more battlecruisers to match the [[Royal Navy]], with assistance from Admiral Alfred von [[Tirpitz (Azur Lane)|]]. In particular, [i]Seydlitz[/i] featured better armor and propulsion over her preceding battlecruisers.

She was commissioned in 1913, with her first crew that of [[Yorck (Azur Lane)|]]'s, having just been transferred to reserve.

She participated in many fleet actions throughout World War I, especially the battles of Dogger Bank and Jutland, where she survived severe damage that would have otherwise sunk her (which explains one of her skills that grants her temporary immunity from being sunk in a sortie). Later, she would have been part of the [[Operation Ten-Gou|Ten Go]]-style "suicidal sortie":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_order_of_24_October_1918] of the German Navy's High Seas Fleet in late October 1918, but mutinies broke out that forced the cancellation of the sortie. A month later, the ship was interned in Scapa Flow with the rest of the High Seas Fleet and scuttled a year later to prevent them from being divvied up by the Allies.

title: sendai_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Sendai[/i], name ship of her class.

In the game, she is depicted having [[blonde hair]], [[yellow eyes]], and the same [[fox girl]] attribute shared to her class. She also wears a mix of traditional [[Japanese clothes]] and a modern [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]] with a red fringe.
Her rig contains two 14 cm single mounts and two twin 61 cm torpedo launchers, one gun and torpedo mount per side. She increases her 14 cm guns upon [[retrofit (azur lane)|]].

In real life, she was the flagship of the Third Destroyer Squadron and was heavily committed to combat operations in the Dutch East Indies and Guadalcanal. Ultimately, she was sunk in a night action in Empress Augusta Bay in early November 1943.

For her retrofit form, see her [[Sendai (retrofit) (azur lane)|corresponding page.]]

body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the USS [i]San Juan[/i], the fourth ship of the [i]Atlanta[/i]-class light cruisers.

She was first released in the [i]Ashen Simulacrum[/i] event on July 2019 in an unusual way: she could only be obtained by spending 10,000 oil as a milestone reward. This practice was never repeated for future events save for the event rerun in March 2021.

title: san_francisco_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [i]New Orleans[/i]-class heavy cruiser USS [i]San Francisco[/i] from Azur Lane.

San Francisco is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[grey hair|grey]] and [[purple hair]] done up in [[twintails]] with a [[double bun]], and [[purple eyes]].

Personality-wise, San Francisco is very flirtatious, deciding to call the player 'Pudding' from the outset (a possible reference to [[Harley Quinn]]).

Character design by [[nagu]].
Voiced by Mineuchi Tomomi.

title: ryuujou_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Ryuujou[/i].
Character design by [[Kinjo Kuromomo]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

h4. Appearance
Her base art portrays her with [[short hair|short]] [[pink hair]], [[dragon horns]], [[dragon tail]], and [[green eyes]], in line with her name (meaning "prancing dragon").

Her outfit consists of a white [[midriff]] with [[white sailor collar]], a white [[military uniform]] coat with traditional [[long sleeves]], a red [[hakama short skirt]], [[rudder footwear]], and dragon scales-themed [[socks]]. Her rig consists of her real-life [[flight deck]] to her right and her bridge and three bow pieces on her left.

h4. History
In real life, [i]Ryuujou[/i] was designed to exploit a loophole in the original Washington Naval Treaty that excluded carriers from total tonnage if they weighed 8,000 tons or less. To that end, she was given a slim cruiser hull, no armor, and a single hangar. However, the 1930 London Naval Treaty closed the loophole, while IJN planners insisted on doubling her air group so a second hangar was placed atop the original, leaving her as the only ship of her class and suffering from questionable seakeeping and stability. She was rebuilt after sustaining storm damage in 1935.

At the start of the war, she was the only carrier available to the IJN for Southeast Asian combat support operations (while the Kido Butai did provide support in the Dutch East Indies, they only did so when needed). Alongside [[Junyou (Azur Lane)|]], they participated in the Aleutians campaign before transferring to Guadalcanal. She was sunk by aircraft from [[Saratoga (Azur Lane)|]] in the battle of the Eastern Solomons in late August 1942.

h4. Skins

title: usada_pekora
body:
A [[rabbit girl]] [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive]]'s third batch "[[hololive Fantasy]]".
Designed by [[Yuuki Hagure]].

Being a rabbit girl, she has [[rabbit ears]] (she also has [[extra ears|regular human ears]]) and a [[rabbit tail]]. She has [[orange eyes|]] or [[red eyes]] with [[rabbit-shaped pupils]], [[short eyebrows|short]] [[thick eyebrows]] shaved into [[hikimayu]], [[small breasts]] and [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]], [[blue hair|blue]]-and-[[white hair]].

Her default hairstyle is [[parted hair]] into [[twintails|twin]] [[twin braids|braids]] with [[carrot hair ornament]]a, [[sidelocks]] and [[swept bangs]].

The posing character in question (often a [[1girl|female character]]) is usually depicted having [[upskirt]], [[pantyshot]], [[pantylines]], [[ass shake|shaking ass]] or [[curvy|voluptuous proportions]].

title: robin_(dc)
body:
The traditional sidekick of [[Batman]]. A legacy title, passed down to several people in the [[DC Comics]] continuity:
* [[Dick Grayson]] - the first Robin, becomes [[Nightwing]] after retiring his previous role
* [[Jason Todd]] - the second Robin, killed on duty; becomes [[red hood (dc)|Red Hood]]
* [[Tim Drake]] - the third Robin, becomes [[Red Robin]] after retiring as Robin
* [[Carrie Kelley]] - Female Robin in an alternate future. Was Not Robin in the normal DC timeline.  Becomes a [[catgirl (dc)|Catgirl]] afterwards
* [[Stephanie Brown]] - The fourth Robin and first female Robin in the normal DC timeline, had the identity for a time, becomes the third [[Batgirl]] afterwards who was trained by [[Barbara Gordon]], the 1st Batgirl
* [[Damian Wayne]] - the fifth Robin, currently holds the title

title: shadowverse
body:
A digital card battle game by [[Cygames]]. The game is divided into a story campaign spread across multiple worlds sci-fi or fantasy alike and a PVP mode featuring various tournaments in addition to "tie-in" events (collaboration events) between different franchises.

Shadowverse was released in June 2016. An [[Shadowverse_(anime)|anime adaptation]] by Zexcs aired from April 2020 to March 2021. A second anime series titled [[shadowverse_flame|Shadowverse Flame]] is currently being aired following the events of the first one after a three-year time skip.

h4. Gameplay

To begin, one must choose one of eight classes to play with (whichever one you choose can be changed later) each with a different playstyle and mechanics. Each class has access to a personal selection of cards in addition to a general pool (which is counted as a ninth class not playable on its own). 

Each player can mulligan their starting hand to find better cards in case of a bad draw. The player who goes first gets 2 evolution points, and the player who goes second gets 3 evolution points. 

At the start of their turn, each player draws one card from their deck and places it in their hand. The player who goes second draws two cards on the first turn. Cards in the deck can't be seen during battle.

h4. See also

* [[shadowverse_(animated_series)|Shadowverse Anime]]
* [[Shadowverse Evolve |]]
* [[Shadowverse: Worlds Beyond|]]
* [[List of Shadowverse characters]]

h4. External links

* "Official Youtube channel":[https://www.youtube.com/@shadowversegame]
* "Shadowverse Wiki":[https://shadowverse.fandom.com/wiki/Shadowverse_Wiki]
* "Wikipedia: Shadowverse":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shadowverse]

Follows the story of [[Magahara Desumi]], the leader of the villainous Gekko who sought world domination. Being in love with the heroic Gelato 5 leader, [[Aikawa Fudou]], her supposedly archrival, both Aikawa and Magahara must date in secrecy while the public perceive them as mortal enemies.

title: the_orville
body:
The Orville is an American science fiction comedy drama television series created by Seth MacFarlane, who also stars as the protagonist Ed Mercer, an officer in the Planetary Union's line of exploratory space vessels in the 25th century. It was inspired primarily by the [[star trek: the original series|original Star Trek]] and [[star trek: the next generation|Next Generation]] eras, both of which it heavily parodies and pays homage to. The series also uses inspiration from the [[Star Wars]] franchise. It follows the crew of the starship USS Orville on their episodic adventures, as well as a serialized story which develops over the length of the series.

She was renamed to [b]Babs[/b] in the English release of the game.

In terms of appearance, Pero's appearance changes multiple times throughout her storyline. Most often, she sports either [[brown hair]] or [[orange hair]]. She also wears either a [[red dress]] or three different variations of a [[nontraditional playboy bunny]] costume.

title: planet
body:
A large spherical astronomical object that typically [[in orbit| orbit]]s a [[star (sky)|]]. The tag should be used when at least one planet is seen from outer [[space]] or from the surface of another nearby planet. This includes real and fictional planets.  

Scientifically, there has always been some ambiguity as to what constitutes a planet, with some celestial bodies such as [[Pluto (planet)|]] and Ceres being considered at different times or by different people either as planets or as "dwarf planets". The International Astronomical Union (IAU) came up with a definition for a planet in 2006, meaning that the planets in our solar system are officially [[Mercury_(planet)|]], [[Venus (planet)|]], [[Earth (planet)|]], [[Mars_(planet)|]], [[Jupiter (planet)|]], [[Saturn (planet)|]], [[Uranus (planet)|]] and [[neptune (planet)|]], but the definition remains contentious.

h4. Planets

* [[Mercury (planet)|]]
* [[Venus (planet)|]]
* [[Earth (planet)|]]
* [[Mars (planet)|]]
* [[Jupiter (planet)|]]
* [[Saturn (planet)|]]
* [[Uranus (planet)|]]
* [[Neptune (planet)|]]
* [[Pluto (planet)|]]

h4. Fictional planets

title: witch's_heart
body:
A story-focused game with horror and light action elements created in RPG Maker 2000 by [[bluestar iz|IZ (BLUE STAR Entertainment)]].  

It follows [[Claire Elford]], a cheerful young woman that gets trapped in a cursed mansion along with four other men - the traveler/witch researcher [[Ashe Bradley]], the mysterious individual [[Wilardo Adler]], a gentle young man named [[Noel Levine]], and the lord of the mansion [[Sirius Gibson]]. Throughout the course of five days, the group has to find a way to escape the mansion, all while uncovering the secrets within it, and learning the truth about the legendary wish-granting treasure: the [i]Witch's Heart[/i]. 

The game is split into four scenarios, each based on the different main characters trapped with Claire, and they’re all mandatory in order to complete the base game. There are mild combat elements through the monsters and bosses the player encounters, as well as a wide variety of mini games and interactions with other characters. 

The game has a sequel named the "Bonus Stage", along with four endings of the routes in the form of separate games called "Conclusion" - though at the time only Sirius’ Conclusion is released.

title: x_(mega_man)
body:
The main protagonist of the [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series. X also serves as a guide during the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] series as [[Cyber Elf X (mega man)|]] and appears as Biometal [[Model X (mega man)|]] in the [[Mega Man ZX]] series. 

He is the successor of the original [[Mega Man (character)|]] and is [[dr. light (mega man)|Dr. Thomas Light's]] greatest creation. Throughout the X series, X is an Maverick Hunter who fights alongside his partners [[zero (mega man)|Zero]] and [[Axl (mega man)|]] in order to maintain peace and stability in the world and protect humans and Reploids alike from Mavericks, though X would like nothing better than the opportunity to stop fighting. Because of his aversion to violence, X is initially ranked a B-Class Hunter, but he is eventually promoted to S-Class.

title: list_of_copy_abilities_in_kirby
body:
Techniques or series of techniques used by [[Kirby]], acquired whenever he swallows certain enemies, usually accompanied by an appropriate costume.

Certain bosses, such as [[Miracle Matter]] or [[Magolor Soul]], are able to use copy abilities as well.

Examples:

* In post #436075, Kirby has copied the Bomb Ability (a typical in-game ability).
* In post #364573, Kirby has copied [[Mario]].

title: panthalassa_(racehorse)
body:
[tn]From "Panthalassa" (from Greek: "all-sea"), the name given to the single ocean that once surrounded Pangaea. It's also an allusion to his sire's name.[/tn]

Real Life Japanese Thoroughbred racehorse. Sired by [[Lord Kanaloa (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Miss Pemberley (this makes [[Montjeu (racehorse)|]] his damsire), he is famed for his extreme front-runner running style that is reminescent of both Twin Turbo and [[Silence Suzuka (racehorse)|]].

He is a bay horse with no markings. He is usually distinguished with his mane tufts and his red and white hood.

Due to his running style and initial limited successes, he was nicknamed the "Twin Turbo of the Reiwa era". But then, starting in late 2021, he started winning bigger and bigger races and was particularly successful overseas, culminating with first G1 win at the 2022 Dubai Turf (albeit, a dead heat, sharing the prize with another horse) and then, despite being more of a turf horse, he won his second G1 win at the 2023 Saudi Cup, which happens to be the race with the largest purse ever held. With this feat, he became the first Japanese horse to have won G1 wins overseas on both turf and dirt as well as instantly catapulting him into second place of Japan's top earning racehorses, having more than doubled his earnings in that one race. Due to his successes overseas, he was rechristened "Panthalassa of the world", a nickname that mirrors his sire's own nickname.

Another race of note for Panthalassa was the 2022 Autumn Tenno-sho. The race saw the front-running horse lead the race by a wide margin, on top of the fact that he ran the race at the same time as Silence Suzuka's ill-fated run of the same race in 1998, even though the race concluded with [[Equinox (racehorse)|]] catching up to Panthalassa and winning the race by a horse length. 

In the context of [i][[Umamusume]][/i], he is most often refered to in fanart in the context of fellow front-runners [[Twin Turbo (umamusume)|]] and [[Silence Suzuka (umamusume)|]] but also in light of [[Maeda Rena]] proclaiming she is Panthalassa's mother, leading to pictures where [[Grass Wonder (umamusume)|]] is treating a baffled horse girl Panthalassa as if she was her baby. Typically, a horse girl Panthalassa is portrayed with a [[ponytail]] or a hairstyle with multiple ponytails, white and red [[ear covers]], a marine-style costume or something that evokes Pangaea and an accessory on or around [b]her right ear[/b].

h5. Related
* [[Contrail (racehorse)|]] - Triple Crown winner; contemporary and stablemate to Panthalassa

title: variations
body:
Pictures of the same character repeatedly in the same image that have been either copied and pasted or redrawn. Only a single outfit should be present, and most of its appearance should be preserved between variations, with only minor alterations to hair/clothing style, color, and accessories. If the difference is more significant, use [[multiple views]] instead.

This should be differentiated from sequential actions, such as a frame-by-frame rendition of a dance, or the stages of creating an illustration (sketch, inking, color, etc.). The latter should be [[how to]]. This also does not include [[comparison]]s between different characters or different characters [[matching outfits|wearing the same outfit]].

Not to be confused with [[variant set]], which refers to a series of images depicting the same scene with some differences.

h4. Examples
* !post #7537363
* !post #7241999
* !post #5404159

title: tachi-e
body:
A [[straight-on|forward-facing]] style of character sprite popular in visual novels. They are commonly (but not always) [[full body]], [[standing]], and feature a [[simple background]].

Tachi-e originated as character art in [[visual novel]]s and adventure games. Often this is a [[looking at viewer|front-facing]] [[game cg|character sprite]] used during conversations with various prepared expressions and poses that can be switched as it flows. It does not strictly require your character to be standing, nor be [[full body]] (e.g. from the [[cowboy shot|knee]] or [[upper body|waist]] up), as long as art is reusable enough - it should qualify.

Aside from the regular tachi-e used in story mode, many gacha games' skin illustration will also have a tachi-e aesthetic, thus they sometimes also come with a [[faux figurine]] counterpart, usually being its evolved form. A clean character art removed from a faux figurine will also likely become a tachi-e if the character is standing, if they're sitting it's [[invisible chair]] instead.

When tagging, use the following rule of thumb: if you can slap an image onto the random background, add a textbox and the result will look like [[fake screenshot]] it should probably be considered a Tachi-e.

Tachi-e is [b]not[/b] applicable if image:

* Has more than one instance of the character ([[turnaround]]s, [[reference sheet]]s, [[multiple views]], [[variations]], [[multiple expressions]], etc...): post #3490670, post #2195716, post #3213462, post #2538995, post #2288278
* Has non [[simple background|simple]] or non [[transparent background]]s ([[zoom layer]]s, [[gradient background]], etc..): post #2925837 (vs post #2951458), post #4133229 (vs post #4133230), post #4028183, post #4151481
* Is a [[character profile]] or featuring character [[stats]]
* Is a [[faux figurine]] or a [[dakimakura (medium)|]]
* Has a tachi-e within [[screenshot]]s or [[fake screenshot]]s: post #818170,  post #1713628
* Has an extra [[outline]]: post #3589935 (vs post #3589913)

h4. Examples

* !post #2251995
* !post #1429310
* !post #3466244
* !post #2922420

h4. See also

* [[variant set]]
* [[tag group:image composition]]

h4. External Links

* "Nico Nico Pedia article":[https://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/立ち絵]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia article":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/立ち絵]

title: expression_chart
body:
A grid-like [[chart]] of [[multiple expressions]].

These are almost always [[meme]]s based on a few fixed [[template]]s, but sometimes an artist will create their own. They often feature jokes in addition to the expression drawing practice.

For varying expressions outside of the [[chart]] format, for instance some [[reference sheet]]s, simply use the [[multiple expressions]] tag on its own.

h4. See also

* [[chart]]
* [[multiple expressions]]

title: multiple_expressions
body:
Several [[variations]] of the same character doing different facial expressions and emotions. This is often in the form of an [[expression chart]], or in a series of small portraits in a [[character profile]] showing a character's different expressions.

h4. Related tags and pools

* "Facial Expression Training":/pools/965

* "Expression 35":/pools/630
* "Expressions and Speeches after Declaration of love":/pools/2077
* [[Slightly Naughty Expressions Practice]]

h4. See also

* [[expression chart]]
* [[Tag group:Face tags]]

title: amamiya_ren
body:
The [[Persona 5]] player character. Voiced by [[Fukuyama Jun]] (JP) / [[Xander Mobus]] (EN).

The leader of the Phantom Thieves. A 16-year-old young man and second-year high school student who transfers to Shujin Academy. He seems quiet and well-mannered at first glance, but gives a completely different impression once he has donned his "phantom thief" guise. He finds residence at Cafe LeBlanc, run by [[Sakura Soujirou]], after getting expelled from his school for being accused of assaulting a man who was molesting a woman.

The name used for his tag is lifted from his anime appearance, [[Persona 5: Dancing Star Night]], as well as being the default name for the 2022 re-release of [[Persona 5 The Royal]]. Previously, the manga adaption gave him the name "Kurusu Akira". His codename among the Phantom Thieves, "Joker", is used as his official name in some other sources, such as his appearance in [[super_smash_bros.|Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]].

h4. Appearance

title: sisterhood_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], the Sisterhood is a major faction within Trinity whose influence is on par with that of the Tea Party and the Knight Hospitaller.

They wish for the happiness and well-being of everyone in Kivotos, but many of Trinity's student are suspicious of them. Being the successors of the infamous Justina Council of Saints, they hold their fair share of secrets; some of which may shed light on Trinity's unknown history...

[b]Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.[/b]

h4. Members

* [[Mari (blue archive)|]]
* [[Hinata (blue archive)|]]
