title: kimono
body:
A kimono (着物) is a type of traditional [[japanese clothes|Japanese clothing]]. It consists of a long, [[wide sleeves|wide-sleeved]] robe, closed at the front forming a "y" shape. It is held closed with a wide belt-like [[sash]] called an [[obi]]. The sleeves can be tied back with [[tasuki]].

Kimonos are often worn with other traditional accessories, such as [[zouri]] (traditional wooden sandals), [[tabi]] (split-toe socks), and [[kanzashi]] (traditional hair ornaments). A [[kinchaku]] (small cloth drawstring bag) is often carried while wearing a kimono.

h4.Correct examples

h5. Traditional Kimono
* !post #8705944: normal kimono
* !post #7250227: with [[tasuki]] and [[hakama]]
* !post #5469136: [[tying]] tasuki

* !post #6586316: [[bride|bridal]] kimono ([[uchikake]])
* !post #7571860: [[shiromuku]] with [[wataboushi]]
* !post #4019977: [[black kimono]] and [[shiromuku]]

h5. Nontraditional Kimono
* !post #1617110: [[kimono skirt]]
* !post #8498629: [[shiromuku]] with [[wataboushi]]
* !post #6267088: [[nontraditional miko]]

h4.Incorrect examples
* !post #6496490: [[Yae Miko]]'s outfit does not resemble a kimono in any way; simply being a [[Japanese Clothes|Japanese-styled]] clothing does not count

h4. Related tags

title: sengoku_nadeko
body:

She is a [[shy]] girl with [[medium hair|medium]] length [[brown hair]]. She usually wears [[casual]] clothes and is often seen wearing a [[cabbie hat]] and has a [[pouch]] by her side.

Alternately, she may be illustrated with [[green hair]] as depicted in [[ren'ai circulation|one of the OP animations]].

title: el_chapulin_colorado
body:
[quote][i]"THEY DIDN'T COUNT ON MY CUNNING....!!!".[/i] - The Chapulin Colorado's catchphrase[/quote]

[b]El Chapulín Colorado[/b] ([i]"The Red Grasshopper"[/i]) is a [[mexico|Mexican]] superhero that stars in [[el chapulin colorado (series)|the comedy show of the same name]]. He wears a red and yellow [[superhero costume|super-powered uniform]] with insect antennae called "Antenitas de Vinil" ("Little Vinyl Antennae") that he uses to detect villains. 

Chapulin is armed with a [[sledgehammer]] called the "[[Chipote Chillon]]" ("Crying Bump"). He also uses special secret pills called "Pastillas de Chiquitolina" ("Tinylenol Tablets") to reduce in size to that of a [[grasshopper]].

The character is played by the same actor who plays [[El Chavo]], "Roberto Gómez Bolaños, a.k.a. Chespirito":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chespirito].

The "BumbleBee Man":https://simpsons.fandom.com/wiki/Pedro_Chespirito from [[The Simpsons]] was inspired by Chapulín. He also appears in the [[One-Punch Man]] anime and manga series as a very similar character called [[Smile Man]].

h4. See also

* [[El Chavo]]
other_names: エル・チャプリン・コロラド

title: vaulted_ceiling
body:
A [i]vaulted ceiling[/i] is an architectural term for arched formations used to hold up a ceiling. Historically, they were made of stone and used to hold ceilings up in large stone structures (such as churches and castles). Will likely also be a [[high ceiling]], but vaulted ceilings were also used in crypts and lower parts of castles with regular ceiling heights so as to support the upper structure.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article on vaults in architecture":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vault_(architecture)]

title: high_ceiling
body: An [[indoors|indoor]] space with a particularly [i]high ceiling[/i], such as might be found in a [[cathedral]] or [[ballroom]]. May also be a [[vaulted ceiling]]. Do not use if the ceiling is not visible unless the location is clearly indoors with tall enough visible walls to imply a high ceiling out of frame.

title: chargeman_ken!
body:
A notoriously bad anime series created by "Knack":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knack_Productions] and broadcasted in 1974. It was made with such poor direction, and on such a ridiculously low budget, that they regularly tried (and failed) to squeeze 20 minutes of plot into the 4 or 5 minutes they could already barely afford to animate for each episode; there were several other obvious production problems as well, such as missing sound effects and a very limited range of background music.

The voice cast for this series is still not publicly known, as no production credits were provided in the actual show.

To this day, several frames of the anime have become popular for artists to redraw:
* !asset #23421763: Shocked Ken
* !asset #23421764: Hoshi-kun
* !asset #23421766: The KMIYs
* !asset #23421765: Yuichi
* !asset #23421767: Papa and Caron
* !asset #23421799: [[Doctor Volga please forgive me! (meme)|]]

h4.Characters

* [[Izumi Ken]] (protagonist)
* [[Izumi Caron]] (Ken's younger sister)
* [[Papa (chargeman_ken!)|]]
* [[Izumi Saori]]
* [[Bariquand (chargeman_ken!)|]] ([[Robot]])
* [[Maou (chargeman_ken!)|]] (the Lucifer - the Commander of Alien Jural)
* [[Hitomi (chargeman_ken!)|]] (Maou masquerading as a girl)
* [[Doctor Volga]]
* [[Hoshi-kun]]

title: rezel_commander_type
body:
A fictional variable geometry manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RGZ-95C ReZEL Commander Type[/b]

A higher spec variant of the [[ReZEL]] [[mobile_suit|MS]]  intended for superior pilots and commanders. The base unit's various limiters are scaled back for maximum performance, and its controls are much more complex allowing for maximum precision in combat. It can be differentiated from the basic ReZEL by its visor and shoulder sensors (they are green in the Commander Type and red in the common ones). 

The mighty General Revil battleship exclusively fielded this variant, which was painted in the GR tan and orange with yellow sensors, and had further refits enabling those special units to equip both the Defenser-a assault pack and Defenser-b long range fire support pack.

title: rezel
body:
A fictional variable  geometry [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise.

[b]RGZ-95 ReZEL[/b]

A high-performance transformable [[Mobile Suit]] fielded by the [[Earth Federation Space Forces]]. By utilizing the [[AEUG]] [[Methuss]]'s simplified transformation mechanism as a base, and integrating it with lessons learned from the [[Z II Gundam]] and the [[Zeta Plus]] series of MS as well as increasing parts commonality with the tried and proven [[Jegan]] made the ReZEL (short for [b]Re[/b]fined [b]Z[/b]eta [b]E[/b]scort [b]L[/b]eader) both highly competent and cheap enough to enter mass production. 

The type was effective in combat, and served as both a booster for the Jegans, who could grab onto ReZELs and fly with them to save fuel, and as a very powerful MS on its own, with a new design beam rifle that emulated the Zeta Gundam's (even able to generate a beam saber blade) and options of additional armament via the Defenser backpacks. 

The uprated [[ReZEL Commander Type]], distingushable from the rank and file ReZELs by its visor and sensors (red in the base model, green in the Commander Types) further pushed the already formidable performance of the unit. It was the EFF's first mass produced, widely operated transformable MS.

title: z_ii_gundam
body:
A fictional variable geometry manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MSZ-008 ZII[/b]

A further development of the Zeta Project, aimed at simplifying the design of the [[zeta Gundam (mobile suit)|Zeta Gundam]] [[mobile suit]] and making it both easier to pilot and cheaper to produce. Using the know-how from the [[Methuss]], the resulting machine - named ZII, read as "Ze-Two" - boasted considerable firepower thanks to the Mega Beam Cannon, which rivaled the Zeta Gundam's High Mega Launcher's output, and achieved its goals of reduced costs and ease of use. 

However, it sacrificed its predecessor's atmospheric entry and flight capabilities, and was ultimately used sparsely until it was retired, while its combat data was taken into account during the development of the more successful [[ReZEL]].

title: obijime
body:
[b]Obijime[/b] (帯締め, おびじめ) is a small decorative string tied around the [[obi]], used only in women's [[kimono]].

It's about 150 cm (4.9 ft) long and is tied around the obi and through the knot, and which doubles as decoration. It can be a woven [[string]], or be constructed as a narrow sewn tube of fabric. There are both flat and round obijime. They often have [[tassel|tassels]] at both ends and are made from [[silk]], [[satin]], brocade or viscose. A cord-like or a padded tube obijime is considered more festive and ceremonial than a flat one.

h4. See also
* [[obiage]]
* [[Japanese clothes]]

h4. External link 

* "An image showing a kimono's components":https://i.pinimg.com/736x/e1/ae/33/e1ae334d27775ba95b8753a054e2a168--traditional-japanese-kimono-traditional-dresses.jpg

title: china_dress
body:
A form-fitting, Chinese-themed [[dress]] that has [[side slit]]s up (usually) both legs and a [[mandarin collar]]. 

The traditional China dress, more properly called a [i]cheongsam[/i] (Cantonese) or [i]qipao[/i] (Mandarin), was introduced in Qing-era China in the 1600s but did not evolve into its current form until the early 20th century. There are many styles, but it typically is a long, form-fitting dress with a [[mandarin collar]], an asymmetric left-over-right opening, high-to-medium [[side slit]]s, and embellished with Chinese [[pankou|frog fasteners]] on the lapel and the collar. It may have any variety of sleeves. 

In anime they are often stylized to be more revealing than the traditional dress, being either very short, or having very long [[side slit]]s with a [[pelvic curtain]] that barely covers anything, or having [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]] or [[back cutout]]s.

Don't use this tag for qipao-styled clothes that aren't dresses, such as shirts or vests. Use [[Chinese clothes]] instead. For example, [[Hong Meiling]]'s default outfit is not a dress.

There are various types of neckline in qipao. The most common type is the [b]Shanghai[/b]-style neckline, which has an asymmetrical closure with frogs leading diagonally up to the collar. The [b]Beijing[/b]-style collar is a simpler symmetrical design, with a frog closure directly beneath the collar. The [b]Jiangnan[/b] style is similar to the Beijing style, but features a [[clothing cutout|hole]] right underneath the collar. 
H4. Examples of each neckline
* !post #6694692: [[Shanghai neckline]]
* !post #4779076: Beijing neckline
* !post #6709972: Jiangnan neckline

h4. Examples

* !post #8066966: A more traditional version, with slits up to the knees and a looser fit.
* !post #5767135: Modern qipao.
* !post #3903700: Short qipao. 
* !post #6642639: Qipao with extremely [[highleg]] side slits. 
* !post #6051354: Variety of exaggeratedly-revealing qipao dresses. 

h4. See also
* [[Changpao]]
* [[Chinese clothes]]
* [[Deel]]
* [[Tangzhuang]]
* [[Ao dai]]


h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Cheongsam":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cheongsam]
other_names: サイドオープンチャイナドレス

"Tearlaments Kitkallos" + 1 "Tearlaments" monster
Other Aqua monsters you control cannot be destroyed by battle. You can only use each of the following effects of "Tearlaments Rulkallos" once per turn. When your opponent activates a card or effect that includes an effect that Special Summons a monster(s) (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it, then, send 1 "Tearlaments" card from your hand or face-up field to the GY. If this Fusion Summoned card is sent to the GY by a card effect: You can Special Summon this card.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 3000
[b]DEF:[/b] 2500

[[Tearlaments Kitkallos]] after standing up to [[Tearlaments Reinoheart]]. She wears an elegant warrior princess outfit and helds the [[sword]] that has a kaleidoscopic pattern on the blade like [[Tearlaments Scheiren]].
other_names: ティアラメンツ・ルルカロス

title: tearlaments_kitkallos
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 5
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Aqua / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 "Tearlaments" monster + 1 Aqua monster
If this card is Special Summoned: You can take 1 "Tearlaments" card from your Deck, and either add it to your hand or send it to the GY. You can target 1 monster you control; Special Summon 1 "Tearlaments" monster from your hand or GY, and if you do, send the targeted monster to the GY. If this card is sent to the GY by card effect: You can send the top 5 cards of your Deck to the GY. You can only use each effect of "Tearlaments Kitkallos" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 2300
[b]DEF:[/b] 1200


Tearlaments Kitkallos is a [[mermaid]]/[[siren (mythology)|]]-themed [[duel monster]] in the Starfrost storyline. Her followers include [[Tearlaments Scheiren]], [[Tearlaments Merrli]], and [[Tearlaments Havnis]].

Tearlaments Kitkallos was brainwashed by [[Tearlaments Reinoheart]] until she stood up to him as [[Tearlaments Rulkallos]] and killed him. She was converted into [[Tearlaments Kashtira]] by [[Kashtira Riseheart]] until [[Visas Starfrost]] was purified into [[Visas Samsara]], who fused the worlds together. As a result, she became [[Mannadium Trisukta]].

There's a running gag in her fan art where she loves to snack on [[Instant Fusion]] noodles, which is a nod to how Instant Fusion is used to cheat out herself or [[El Shaddoll Winda]] in Tearlaments decks.

She's often paired up with [[Visas Starfrost]] since many believe her to be the heroine of the Visas Starfrost storyline.
other_names: ティアラメンツ・キトカロス

body: Takeru "T.K." Takaishi (高石 タケル, Takaishi Takeru) is a character in the anime series [[Digimon Adventure]], [[Digimon Adventure 02]], and [[Digimon Adventure tri.]] and its assosiated media. He is a DigiDestined, partnered with [[Patamon]], and embodies the trait of Hope. He is the younger brother of Yamato "Matt" Ishida.

title: half-skirt
body:
A type of [[skirt]] that leaves one leg exposed by ending around the crotch area on the front and around the side or the back of the thigh area on the other, often [[overskirt|worn over]] a pair of [[shorts]] or a shorter skirt, although many times they come as a single piece.

Not to be confused with a [[showgirl skirt]], in which the entire front area is missing, or with a [[high-low skirt]] in which the front half is shorter than the back.

If it's clear that it's being worn over a separate skirt, shorts or pants, also tag [[overskirt]].

title: dress_lift
body:
Lifting up a person's dress, usually with the intent to show off their underwear or bare crotch/butt. Usually this is done either by the wearer of the dress or someone nearby. It could also be caused by an inanimate object, such as a hook or other object that might catch the dress and lift it up. It can be done voluntarily or involuntarily (by another person/object).

If the dress is merely being held - not in a particularly revealing fashion - use the tag [[skirt hold]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[bra lift]]
* [[dress pull]]
* [[dress tug]]
* [[skirt lift]]
* [[shirt lift]]

title: skirt_hold
body:
Lifting a [[skirt]] or [[dress]] in a non-revealing fashion (as opposed to [[skirt lift]]), typically so it doesn't touch the floor.

If the character is pulling the skirt down so as to hide their underwear and/or legs, use [[skirt tug]].

For holding objects in a skirt, see [[skirt basket]].  For holding a skirt that's not being worn, see [[holding unworn skirt]].

h4. Examples

* !post #7230292

h4. See also

* [[curtsey]]
* [[cape hold]]
* [[coat hold]]

title: langley_ii_(azur_lane)
body: The personification of the [i]Independence[/i]-class USS [i]Langley[/i] (CVL-27) in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]. Not to be confused with [[Langley (Azur Lane)|her namesake predecessor, CV-1]], although it is specified that Langley II has the body and memories of the original Langley but with [i]Independence[/i]-class equipment and abilities. As she is basically the original [i]Langley[/i] with a new rig, her physical attributes remain unchanged ([[long hair|long]] [[green hair]], [[brown eyes]], [[small breasts]], wearing [[glasses]]) except a slight height increase. Her outfit as an [i]Independence[/i]-class light carrier is now composed of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[shirt tucked in]], [[black jacket]], striped [[necktie]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[black footwear|black]] [[rudder footwear]], and [[black gloves]]. Her new [[rigging]] comprises two halves of her [[flight deck]], one on each side, with two [[anti-aircraft gun]]s per rig and operating a mix of newer wartime aircraft with older biplanes from her previous form. h4. Skins * !post #5920478: Default * !post #5923681: [[langley_ii_(on-the-clock_vacation)_(azur_lane)|On-the-Clock Vacation]] (can be used on the original Langley) h4. Related characters h5. title: massachusetts_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Massachusetts[/i] (BB-59). Character design by [[Zeco|]].

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with a [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streak]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]], albeit just like her sister [i]South Dakota[/i], looks slim relative to the large rigging she wears. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue jacket]] worn [[off shoulder]], [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt|white]] [[midriff]], [[black necktie]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is the same as her sister's, sporting her three historical 406 mm triple gun mounts and ten 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP]] gun mounts on a hull that is painted in Measure 22, her real-life camouflage scheme in the Naval Battle of Casablanca. She also carries her real-life mainmast with SG and SC-1 [[radar]]s on top as a [[staff]]. 

h4. Skins

* !post #5665309: Base
* !post #5661307: Kai
* !post #8307732: [[massachusetts_(yukata_mode)_(kancolle)|Yukata]]

h4. History
In real life, [i]Massachusetts[/i] was the only one of the class to have initially seen frontline service in the Atlantic/Mediterranean theaters, bombarding Casablanca in November 1942 (the setting of the 2022 Summer event, including her gunnery exchange with [i][[Jean Bart (Kancolle)|]][/i], in anchor at that time). She was only transferred to the Pacific in early 1943 to replace her sister [i]South Dakota[/i] (then headed stateside for repairs), seeing action escorting the carrier forces.

Post-war, she was decommissioned in 1947, but it took until 1965 for her to become a museum ship.

h4. [i]South Dakota[/i]-class battleships
* [[South Dakota (Kancolle)|]] (BB-57)
* [b]Massachusetts[/b] (BB-59)

h4. See also
* [[Jean Bart (Kancolle)|]]
* [[Massachusetts (Azur Lane)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: USS [i]Massachusetts[/i] (BB-59)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Massachusetts_%28BB-59%29]

title: levchenko_ahapiia_oleksandrivna
body:
Levchenko Ahapiia Oleksandrivna (more commonly known as Ahapa) is a female Ukrainian character who is a police officer, subject to the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine. Her companion is [[Victor Melnyk]].

She was designed in 2022 by [[Linyvets chan]] as the counter-response of [[Alpha (Alpha 1918)|Alpha 1918]] during the [[russo-ukrainian war|2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine]], drawing inspiration from the German-installed Second Ukrainian Hetmanate which existed briefly after the end of World War I.

* "Marichka Wiki (Ukrainian)":https://marichka.fandom.com/uk/wiki/%D0%90%D0%B3%D0%B0%D0%BF%D0%B0

title: herta_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Yamazaki Haruka]] in Japanese.

She is the master of the eponymous Herta Space Station, who appears in the form of a puppet she modeled after her younger self, as well as an Emanator of Erudition.

She (or rather, her puppet) is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[hair intakes]], [[purple eyes]], and [[doll joints]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[white dress]] worn under an outer layer [[black dress|black]] [[sailor dress]], [[black hat|black]] [[beret]] with a [[purple flower]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heel boots]]. She uses a [[hammer]] as her main weapon. 

h4. Skins

* !post #7689962: Splash art (4-star)
* !post #8704047: [[The herta (honkai: star rail)|Emanator of Erudition]] (5-star)
* !asset #23561803: Herta's [[Herta (Simulated Universe Avatar) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Simulated Universe avatar]]

h4. Profile
[expand]
Herta Space Station's true master.

As the human with the highest IQ in The Blue, she only does what she's interested in, dropping whatever project immediately the moment she loses interest — the best example being the space station.

She typically appears in the form of a ranged puppet. "It's about seventy percent similar to how I looked as a child."
[/expand]

h4. See Also
* [[Herta (Wisteria Cake) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Ruan Mei's creations: Wisteria Cake]]

title: kantai_collection_(anime)
body:
The three anime projects based off the browser game [[Kantai Collection]].

The original anime aired in January 2015 and is loosely based off the first six months of the Pacific War leading up to the [[Battle of Midway]]. A follow-up film, [i]KanColle: The Movie[/i], was released in November 2016, and is based off the Guadalcanal Campaign.

The third anime project, [i]Itsuka Ano Umi de[/i] (いつかあの海で), was released in November 2022 and is based off the battle of Leyte Gulf up to [[Operation Ten-gou]].

The original 2015 series and 2016 film featured [[Fubuki (kancolle)|]] as the main character, with the storyline based on her point of view. The 2022 series, however, features [[Shigure (Kancolle)|]] as the main character. 

h4. Official key visual

* !post #1766790: 2015
* !post #5438643: 2016
* !post #5225622: Itsuka Ano Umi De

h4. See also

* [[poi face]]
* [[waterskiing (meme)]]

title: shiratsuyu_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
Upon reaching kai ni, [[shiratsuyu (kancolle)|Shiratsuyu's]] hair is now longer and shifts towards a faint blue color, while sporting the distinctive [[hair flaps]] seen among her remodeled sisters. She also wears a [[whistle]] [[whistle around neck|around her neck]]. In addition, her breasts become more noticeably prominent. 

Her outfit now includes [[fingerless gloves]] and a longer right sleeve, while her legwear changes to [[thighhighs]], giving her [[zettai ryouiki]].

As for her [[rigging]], she replaces her 12.7 cm single gun mount Type A with a second twin mount Type C in an attachment on her left that also includes her historic Type 22 [[radar]]. On her mast, the flag signals "5" and "Z" are flown from the halyard.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3187783

title: eyebrow_razor
body: A [[razor]] that is designed to trim one's eyebrows and light facial hair. Similar in design to a [[straight razor]] or kamisori but not nearly as sharp. It has a notched blade and it's handle is usually made of plastic. When not in use, a clear plastic cover may be put over the blade or it may be folded shut.

title: gundam_the_battle_master
body:
[b]Gundam: The Battle Master[/b] ([i]Gandamu Za Batorumasutā[/i]) -Later known as [b]Gundam Battle Assault[/b]- is a fighting [[video game]] set in the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse that was released on the [[PlayStation]] console in 1997 only in [[Japan]]. 

GTBM was published by [[Bandai]] and developed by [[natsume_(company)|Natsume]]. It is notable because it is considered the first game in the [[Gundam Battle Assault]] series. Despite the game never being released overseas, its opening narration is spoken entirely in English.

h4. Notable mecha
* [[Psyco Gundam Mk III]]
other_names: ガンダム・ザ・バトルマスター

title: psyco_gundam_mk_ii
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]MRX-010 Psyco Gundam Mk. II[/b]

A further evolution of the [[Psyco Gundam]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], the sinister-looking [b]Mk. II[/b] was enhanced with also the capacity to transform and a different, purplish finish. It was piloted by [[Rosamia Badam]] ([[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]) and later [[Puru Two]] ([[Neo Zeon]]).

h4. See also
* [[Psyco Gundam Mk III]]

title: world_of_warships
body:
A multiplayer naval combat game developed by Wargaming. Featuring [[World War I]] ironclads, [[World War II]] ships and Fictional/Prototype ships that were never been made into steel or design only. This game also features Superships, these ships are created or designed during 1945 with advanced technology, surpassing warships from the second world war.

Notably, it's collaborated with [[Aoki Hagane no Arpeggio]], [[High School Fleet]], [[Azur Lane]] and [[Blue Archive]]. Azur Lane in particular further partners with WoWs to receive inspiration for its annual Priority Research ship series.

h4. See also

* [[World of Tanks]]
* [[War Thunder]]

title: ultraman_(ultraman:_rising)
body: The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman: Rising]]. His human host is [[Sato Kenji]]. Due to only being referred to as Ultraman in the movie, he is often referred to with additional names to distinguish him from other Ultramen, such as [i]Risingman[/i] and [i]Ultraman Rising[/i] (derived from the movie title), [i]Ultra Ken[/i] and [i]Ultraman Ken(ji)[/i] (derived from his host, albeit having to further distinguish him from [[Father of Ultra|Ultraman Ken]]). In the Ultraman Card Game, he's been referred to as "Ultraman (Sato Ken)".

title: stalker_(1979)
body:
Stalker (Russian: Сталкер) is a 1979 Soviet science fiction film directed by Andrei Tarkovsky. The film tells the story of an expedition led by a figure known as the "Stalker", who guides his two clients—a melancholic writer and a professor—through a hazardous wasteland to a mysterious restricted site known simply as the "Zone".

Upon release, the film garnered praise in the Soviet and Warsaw Pact press, but only mixed reviews in the West. However, in subsequent years it has been recognized as one of the greatest films of all time.

The film is the direct inspiration of the [[stalker_(game)|video game series]] of the same name.

h4. External Links
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stalker_(1979_film)

body:
A fictional variable geometry manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MSZ-006A1 Zeta Plus[/b]

The mass produced version of the powerful but extremely complex and expensive [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]] [[mobile suit]]. title: isaku
body:
An eroge developed by elf, and the first game in the "[[Saku (series)|-saku]]" series. It was originally released for the [[PC-98]] in 1995, and later remade for [[Microsoft Windows]] platforms in 1999. All artwork for both versions were illustrated by [[Yokota Mamoru]].

Unlike its successors, Isaku is a horror-themed escape game that follows [[Kogure Kenta]] as he attempts to escape an abandoned school building with serveral other students trapped with him. All the while, he must outwit the titular antagonist [[Itou Isaku]], who will attempt to rape and torture the other students should they be caught.

title: rapi_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the [[Counters (nikke)|]] squad along with [[anis (nikke)|Anis]] and [[neon (nikke)|Neon]], Rapi is usually protective, obedient, and an expressionless Nikke. 

She has [[orange eyes]], [[large breasts]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]]. She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]], [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black leotard|black]] [[collared leotard]], [[red necktie]], [[black gloves|black]] and [[red gloves|red]] [[two-tone gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear]], and a [[black choker]]. Usually depicted [[holding gun|holding]] or having an [[CZ 805 BREN]] [[assault rifle]] [[gun on back|on her back]].

[spoilers]Rapi was once a [[rapi_(mass_produced)_(nikke)|Mass-produced Nikke]] with the serial number RR-15436. At some point in time, Rapi met [[Red Hood (nikke)|]], a former member of the legendary [[Goddess (nikke)|]] squad. When Red Hood died, Rapi somehow assimilated her entire body, more than doubling her mass and giving her a second core, a feat believed to be impossible. This has given her the ability to release immense heat from her body and intensifying her strength.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]Later she was upgraded and became a member of [[Absolute (Nikke)|]], Elysion's most powerful squad consisting (currently) of [[Emma (nikke)|]], [[Eunhwa (nikke)|]], and [[Vesti (nikke)|]]. However during a mission, one of Rapi's explosives killed a human, causing her to have an identity crisis. This led to Rapi leaving Absolute, much to her teammates dismay, and eventually joining the [[Counters (nikke)|]].[/spoilers]

Illustrators: [[Kim Hyung tae|Kim Hyung-tae]] and [[Hyulla]]

h4. Skins

title: viper_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]] and a member of [[Exotic (nikke)|]] together with [[Crow (Nikke)|]] and [[Jackal (Nikke)|]]. She's the staff officer of Exotic. She can manipulate any human with her verbal trickery and physical beauty.

She has [[pink eyes| pink]]/[[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], and [[very long hair|very long]]/[[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]] with [[bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and [[hair intakes]]. She has [[horns]] and [[earrings]] and wears a [[mouth mask]] which she usually pulls [[mask pull|down]]. She wears a [[crop top]] with a [[zipper]] and a [[chest harness]], showing her [[cleavage]] and [[bare shoulders]]. She wears [[white gloves| white]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[fingerless gloves]] sometimes showing off her [[nail polish|polished]] nails, and also a [[pink jacket]]. She wears a [[chain]], [[fishnet pantyhose]], a [[holographic clothing|holographic]] [[pleated skirt]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[high heels]]. Also wears a [[black collar]] with a [[heart collar|heart]] on it, slightly above or underneath said collar she wears a [[choker]].

Illustrator: [[Dore (gilles dore)|DORE]]

title: suicideboys
body:
An American rapper duo from New Orleans, Lousiana, consisting of rappers [[Scrim]] (born Scott Arceneaux Jr. on April 11, 1989) and [[Ruby da Cherry]] (born Aristos Petrou on April 22, 1990). They are founders of the independent record label [G59 Records](https://g59records.com) that houses fellow rappers like Ramirez, Shakewell and "Germ":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Germ_(rapper)].

h4. See also:
* [[Lil Peep]], a fellow American rapper with connections to the Suicideboys through collaborations

title: lil_peep
body:
Gustav Elijah Ahr (born November 1, 1996, died November 21, 2017), known by the stage name Lil Peep (formerly Trap Goose from 2013-2014), was a rapper/singer credited with helping develop the genre of [emo rap.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emo_rap) Before his death, his popularity in the underground rap scene and being in a group like [GothBoiClique](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GothBoiClique) helped him rise up in the industry. His 1st and only studio album to be released before his death [Come Over When You're Sober, Part 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Come_Over_When_You%27re_Sober,_Pt._1) managed to chart the Billboard 200, peaking at #38.

h4. See also:
* [[Suicideboys]], an American rapper duo with connections to Lil Peep through collaborations

title: yu-bird
body:
Yu-bird is a female side character / [[creature]] from [[Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi]].  It is in it's true form a creature with a raven-like body and a head resembling that of its master [[Yubaba]]'s. It initially serves as Yubaba's servant / spy. Throughout much of the movie it is transformed into another form referred to as "Haedori" / "Fly-Bird", with the head of a tiny bird, and the body of a fly.

It develops an affinity for and is often paired alongside [[Bou (Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi)|]] in his transformed mouse form and carries him around.

body: "Bou" is a male side character from [[Sen to Chihiro no Kamikakushi]].  He is [[Yubaba]]'s [[mother and son|son]], and in his true form appears as a giant [[baby]] wearing a red [[dudou]] with his name on it.  For much of the film he is transformed into a plump [[mouse]] who largely moves around by means of being carried by the transformed fly-like version of [[Yu-Bird]], for whom he develops an affinity towards and is usually paired with.

title: ferrari_enzo_ferrari
body: A mid-engine [[sports car]] that served as the flagship car of [[Ferrari]] from 2002 to 2013, succeeding the [[Ferrari F50]]. It is named after the company's founder; Enzo Ferrari.

title: ferrari_laferrari
body:
Also known as the F150, this is a [[Ferrari]] hybrid hypercar. At the time of its introduction in 2013, it was the strongest production car manufactured by the company, and it was the successor to the [[Ferrari Enzo Ferrari]] as the brand's mid-engined V12 halo car.

It is widely believed to be the car associated with [[Taihou (Azur Lane)|Taihou]]'s [[Taihou (Enraptured Companion)  (Azur Lane)|Enraptured Companion]] [[race queen]] skin in [i][[Azur Lane]][/i].

title: ferrari_f80
body: The current flagship car of [[Ferrari]], serving as the successor of the [[Ferrari LaFerrari]]. It was announced on October 2024 and is set to enter production in 2025. Also known as the F250.

title: bai_clothes
body: The Bai - or Pai - are an East Asian ethnic group native to the Bijie area of Guizhou Province, and Sangzhi area of Hunan Province. They constitute one of the 56 ethnic groups officially recognized by China. The Bai people hold the colour white in high esteem, (hence the use of 'Bai', Chinese for 'white', in their name). "The Bai people, as their name would suggest, favor white clothes and decorations. Women generally wear white dresses, sleeveless jackets of red, blue, or black, embroidered belts, loose trousers, embroidered shoes of white cloth, and jewelry made of gold or silver. Women in Dali traditionally wear a white coat trimmed with a black or purple collar, loose blue trousers, embroidered shoes, silver bracelets, and earrings. Unmarried women wear a single pigtail on the top of their head, while married women roll their hair. The men wear white jackets, black-collared coats, and dark loose shorts. Their headwear and costume reflect the Bai symbols: the snow, the moon, the flower, and the wind. Many Bai women style their hair in a long braid wrapped in a headcloth. This style is called 'the phoenix bows its head'." (Wikipedia) h4. See also * [[Chinese Clothes]] h4. External links * "Wikipedia: Bai People":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Hanfu

title: pineapple_on_pizza
body:
Any kind of [[pizza]] topped with [[pineapple]], whether as chunks traditionally, or humorously slices or even whole. Humorously associated with the Food Atrocities pool, and the [[How to Torture an Italian (meme)|]] [[meme]] due to how some people consider this combination disgusting.

The most common sort of pizza with pineapple on it is [[Hawaiian pizza]], which pairs the pineapple with ham (or Canadian bacon/salami/etc), to the point where to many people 'Hawaiian pizza' is synonymous with 'Pineapple pizza'.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: pizza_time_(meme)
body:
Pizza Time is a quote from [[Spider-Man 2]], the 2004 [[Spider-Man]] film directed by Sam Raimi and starring [[Tobey Maguire]] as [[Peter Parker]]. The quote has been used in various remix memes and shitposts as well as a reaction image.

H4. Origin
At the beginning of Spider-Man 2, Peter Parker is working as a [[pizza]] delivery boy while juggling his duties as Spider-Man. When delivering pizza to a customer, he says the phrase, "Pizza time!"

title: mazepynka
body: A mazepynka is a cap worn by Ukrainian soldiers. Created by Levko Lepkyi for the Ukrainian Sich Riflemen in 1916, it was named for 17th-century Ukrainian leader Ivan Mazepa, and is still used by the Ukrainian Armed Forces today.

title: petliurivka
body: Petliurivka is a soft British-style cap introduced to the Ukrainian army by Hetman Pavlo Skoropadskyi in 1918. It was used by the Army of the Ukrainian People's Republic (1918-1920) and replaced the [[mazepynka]] of the Ukrainian Galician Army (1918-1920) after the merger of the two armies.

body:
Coverings for the arms.

Popular in several alternative fashion trends, such as [[decora]], [[punk]], [[y2k_fashion|Y2K]], [[emo fashion|emo]] and [[scene fashion]].

title: daisy_(doom)
body:
[[Doomguy]]'s pet [[rabbit]], seen at the end of [[doom i|the first game]]. [spoiler]Their severed head is on a pike, ahead of a burning city.[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [[DOOM (series)|]]

title: rocket_jumping
body:
A term first popularized by Id's [[Quake 1]] but also used in their grand daddy of games, [[Doom i]], albeit not as popular as the former.

It involves using an explosion, usually caused by a rocket from a [[rocket launcher]] but other's also include sticky jumping from [[Demoman (tf2)|]] from [[Team Fortress 2]], and use it to propel the user with great momentum either towards the sky or to a point quickly.

The most prominent user of rocket jumping is [[Soldier (tf2)|]] which in game encourages the player to learn rocket jumping to get to points where are regarded as impossible to be on or get to it quickly.

title: plasma_rifle
body: A type of [[energy gun|energy]] [[rifle]] that shoots [[plasma]]. The most recognizable examples are the ones from [[Halo (series)|]] and [[Doom i]].

title: fireblu_(doom)
body:
Fireblu is a pulsating red/blue texture from the game [[Doom i]], considered to be garish and ugly.

title: spider_mastermind
body:
The final boss of the first [[Doom i]] game, and recurring boss in [[Doom II]]. An enormous brain with a face and arms, supported by spider-like robotic legs, with a [[gatling gun]] attached to it's chassis.

Returns in [[Doom (2016)]] as the final boss there as well, instead with a [[plasma rifle]] attached to its chassis.

h4. See also
* [[DOOM (series)|]]
* [[Cyberdemon]]
* [[Arachnotron]]

title: doom_i
body:
A 1993 first-person shooter [[video game]] developed by [[id Software]] for the MS-DOS operating system.

In the game a lone space marine (the [[Doomguy]]) fights [[demon]]s using high-tech weaponry. 

Doom is often credited with popularizing the first-person shooter (FPS) game genre.

h4. See also

* [[Legacy of Rust]]

Often used in [[applying manicure]]s and [[applying pedicure]]s.

title: cloth
body:
A small piece of fabric for a particular purpose, usually related to cleaning. 

Don't use this tag for [[handkerchief]]s, [[tablecloth]]s, [[wash cloth]]s, [[hand towel]]s, [[cleaning rag]]s, or other kind of cloths with a more specific tag.

h4. Examples

* !post #7581533
* !post #6757310

title: handkerchief
body:
A small piece of fabric used for personal hygiene such as [[wiping]] one's face or [[blowing nose|blowing one's nose]].

See [[pocket square]] for a handkerchief worn in the breast pocket of a [[suit jacket]].

h4. See also

* [[cloth]]
* [[cleaning rag]]
* [[napkin]]
* [[pocket square]]

title: pocket_square
body: A folded piece of cloth worn in the [[breast pocket]] of a formal [[suit jacket]].

title: suit
body:

Do not use if the character is not wearing the [[suit jacket]].

title: hatsune_miku_(vocaloid4)
body:
The [[VOCALOID]]4 voicebank for [[Hatsune Miku]] (dubbed V4X). Continuing from her [[hatsune miku (vocaloid3)|VOCALOID3 design]], the design for this version is once again illustrated by [[iXima]]. This would be her last VOCALOID voicebank for 8 years, switching to [[Hatsune Miku (NT)|Pripro Studio]] in the meantime, before returning with her VOCALOID6 iteration.

Following a similar design to V3, she now has tighter [[detached sleeves]] and [[thigh boots]] that are [[see-through footwear|see-through]]. The [[skirt]] is still double layered, she has a smaller [[headset]], a white [[sleeveless shirt]] with translucent aqua strips along the shoulders, and pink [[hair ornament]]s (now single pink squares).

h4. Official art

* !post #2534170
* !post #2534159
* !post #2534175
* !post #5740267

h4. See also
* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

It consists of a [[white hat|white]] [[beret]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[crop top]] with red [[drawstring]]s and [[shoulder cutout|shoulder cutouts]], worn over a [[white leotard]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]], and white [[asymmetrical legwear]] ([[white socks]] on her right and [[single thighhigh|single]] [[white thighhighs|white thighhigh]] with [[garter straps|garter strap]] on her left).

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[cropped shirt]] with a [[single sleeve]] [[long sleeves|long sleeve]], [[white pants|white]] [[cargo pants]], a [[black belt]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[boots]]. In this outfit, [[official alternate hairstyle|she wears]] a [[two side up|two-side-up]], along with a [[single earring|single]] [[heart earrings|heart earring]].

body:

It consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] and [[shoulder cutout]], which is [[shirt tucked in|tucked underneath]] a pair of [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]]. She also wears a [[red bowtie]], a [[thigh pouch]], an [[uneven legwear|uneven]] pair of [[white socks]] (one ankle-height and [[single over-kneehigh|one over-kneeheight]]), and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[boots]]. She [[official alternate hairstyle|switches her hairstyle]] into featuring a [[side ponytail]] in this outfit.

title: chuo_academy_school_uniform
body:
A [[school uniform]] in [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]], first introduced in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden|Magia Record]].

It is a [[serafuku]] consisting of a [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar|blue]] [[sailor shirt|sailor collar]] and [[short over long sleeves]], a [[breast pocket]] and the [[school emblem]]; a [[short necktie|short]] [[blue necktie|blue]] [[necktie]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[blue skirt|blue]] [[gingham skirt|gingham]] [[miniskirt]] with [[buttons]], and [[loafers]].

h4. Notable students

* [[Awane Kokoro]] (pairs with [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]])
* [[Ayano Rika]] (pairs with [[white thighhighs]])
* [[Chun Meiyui]] (pairs with [[white thighhighs]])
* [[Eri Aimi]] (pairs with [[white thighhighs]])
* [[Kagami Masara]] (pairs with [[white socks]]; changes the loafers for [[mary janes]])
* [[Mariko Ayaka]] (pairs with [[black thighhighs]])
* [[Mitsuki Felicia]] (pairs with [[white socks|white]] [[kneehighs]] and [[orange wristband]]s; only wears the [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] part of the shirt)

title: ayano_rika's_ex
body:
A nameless character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. She is the ex-girlfriend of [[Ayano Rika]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[purple hair]] with [[long bangs|long]] [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[bangs]] that [[hair over eyes|cover]] [[covered eyes|her eyes]]. She wears the [[Chuo Academy school uniform]].

title: sena_mikoto's_mother
body:
A nameless character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. She is the mother of [[Sena Mikoto]].

She has no canon design.

title: satomi_tasuke
body: An NPC in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. He is [[Satomi Nayuta]]'s father, [[Satomi Touka]]'s uncle and [[Satomi touka's father]]'s brother.

title: satomi_touka's_father
body:
An unnamed character in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. He is the father of [[Satomi Touka]], the brother of [[Satomi Tasuke]] and the uncle of [[Satomi Nayuta]]. He also works as a doctor.

He's a [[mature male|middle-aged man]] with [[brown eyes]] and [[very short hair|very short]] [[brown hair]]. He wears a [[white coat|white]] [[coat]] with [[lapels]], [[long sleeves]], [[buttons]] and a [[breast pocket]]; a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], a [[red necktie|red]] [[necktie]] and [[grey pants|grey]] [[pants]]. He is also often seen with a [[stethoscope]] and a [[lanyard]].

It consists of a [[black choker]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[white jacket]] with the [[sleeves rolled up]], [[white shorts]], [[fishnet socks]], and [[white footwear|white]] high-cut [[sneakers]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she wears her [[short hair]] with a [[short ponytail|ponytail]] and has[[blue eyeshadow]].

title: brock_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Brock[/b], known as [b]Takeshi[/b] (タケシ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

Known as the rock-solid Pokémon Trainer, he is a reliable Gym Leader who watches over and supports younger Trainers [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Onix]].

In his [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, he has mostly [[closed eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[brown hair]]. He wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[orange shirt]] with a [[v-neck]], a [[loose belt|loose]] [[black belt]], [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[green pants]], and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[shoes]].

An example of [[4Kids]]' infamous localizations.

In [[Pokemon (classic anime)|]] S1E25 [i]"[[Primeape]] Goes Bananas"[/i], [[Brock (pokemon)|]] repeatedly refers to [[onigiri]] (rice balls) as "jelly-filled [[donut]]s".

title: tag_group:holidays_and_celebrations
body:
[See [[tag groups]].] 

Existing tags for various Holidays, Celebrations, and associated tags. 

h4. Dated Holidays and Celebrations (Once per year)

* Jan 01: [[New Year|New Year's Day]]

* Jan 21-Feb 20: [[Chinese New Year]]
* Feb 02: [[Twintails Day]]
* Feb 03: [[Setsubun]]
* Feb 14: [[valentine|Valentine's Day]]
* Feb 22: [[Cat Day]]
* Mar 03: [[Hinamatsuri]] 
* Mar 08: [[Women's Day]]
* Mar 09: [[Miku day]]
* Mar 14: [[White Day]]
* Mar 17: [[Saint Patrick's Day]]
* Mar-Apr: [[Hanami]]
* Mar-Apr: [[Easter]]
* April 01: [[April Fools]]

title: innertube
body:
A flotation device used as a recreational swimming aid, especially by young children and older persons who cannot swim. So called because it resembles (and in earlier times, usually [i]was[/i]) the inner tube of a car tire.

On Danbooru, often constructed of [[transparent]] material, ostensibly for better visibility of the wearer.

A [[lifebuoy]] is visually similar, but its use and usual material composition are different.

h4. See also
* [[inflatable toy]]
* [[donut innertube]]
* [[duck innertube]]
* [[watermelon innertube]]
* [[innertube with ears]]

title: double_bun
body:
A hairstyle in which the hair is wrapped into two round [[hair bun]]s.

The Japanese nickname for the hairstyle is "odango", literally meaning "dumpling". Classic example is [[Tsukino Usagi]] of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]].

h4. See also

title: lidelle_(puyopuyo)
body: [[Puyopuyo]] character. She has [[green hair]], [[donut hair bun]]s and [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[purple eyes]]. She also has [[pointy ears]] with [[ear tufts|tufts]]. She debuted in [[Puyopuyo Fever]]. Costume Changes * !asset #22974833: Puyopuyo Fever * !asset #22974873: [[Puyopuyo Fever 2]] * !asset #22974911: [[Puyopuyo 20th Anniversary]] to present h4. Trivia * She has low self-esteem, and hides her horns in her hair. * She likes to call [[Satan (puyopuyo)|]] and [[Draco Centauros]] "big brother" and "big sister" respectively because of their [[hair color connection|shared hair color]] and horns. * She was formerly known as Rider prior to 2017, coinciding with the English localization of [[Puyopuyo Tetris]]. h4. [[Official alternate costume]]s These are costumes found in [[Puyopuyo Quest]]: * !asset #22974752: {{lidelle_(andromeda)_(puyopuyo)|Andromeda Lidelle}} * !asset #22974761: {{lidelle_(gallant)_(puyopuyo)|Gallant Lidelle}} * !asset #22974749: {{Flower Bed Lidelle}} * !asset #22974766: {{lidelle_(miracle_hunter)_(puyopuyo)|Miracle Hunter Lidelle}} h4. See also * [[List of Puyopuyo characters]]

title: rosa_(pokemon)
body:
The female protagonist of [[pokemon_bw2|Pokemon Black 2 and White 2]]. Sometimes nicknamed "Donut-ko". Her male counterpart is [[Nate (pokemon)|]].

Known as [b]Mei[/b] in Japanese versions. Their Japanese names come from [i]kyoumei[/i] (共鳴), meaning "resonance". In English, this association is also kept, with "resonate" turning into "Rosa" and "Nate". 

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[brown hair]] worn in [[twintails]] with [[double bun|double]] [[donut hair bun]]s. She wears a [[visor cap]], a shirt with [[raglan sleeves]] and a [[pink bow]], [[yellow shorts|yellow]] [[short shorts]] [[pantyhose under shorts|worn over]] [[black pantyhose]], [[sneakers]], and she carries a [[handbag]].

Already a popular player character in her own right, Rosa enjoyed a resurgence in popularity after being revealed as an early-game free character in the story of [[Pokemon Masters EX]]. In this game, Rosa's partner is [[Snivy]], and became known for her upbeat attitude and [[stroking own chin|multitude]] of [[+_+|expressions]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Whitley[/b] (ファイツ [i]Whi-Two[/i] in Japanese).

h4. Official Art
* !post #2480022

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Whitley (Adventures)":[https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Whitley_(Adventures)]

title: donut_hair_bun
body:
A type of [[hair bun]] where the hair is rolled using a hairdressing item called a hair donut, rather than coiling hair around repeatedly as seen in the traditional odango-styled hair bun. The resulting hair bun indeed resembles a circular [[donut]].

Not to be confused with [[hair rings]].

title: pastry_box
body:
A [[box]] designed for carrying multiple [[pastry|pastries]] such as [[cupcake|cupcakes]] or [[donut|doughnuts]], usually either a half dozen or a whole dozen. Two common designs are seen - one as a long flat box that the pastries can sit in without being ruined; the other as a square box with flaps that open at the top and have a slot at the top for easy carrying.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
